788 IMGUI_API bool TabItemButton(const char* label, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags = 0); // create a Tab behaving like a button. return true when clicked. cannot be selected in the tab bar.
789 IMGUI_API void SetTabItemClosed(const char* tab_or_docked_window_label); // notify TabBar or Docking system of a closed tab/window ahead (useful to reduce visual flicker on reorderable tab bars). For tab-bar: call after BeginTabBar() and before Tab submissions. Otherwise call with a window name.
790
791 // Docking
792 // [BETA API] Enable with io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable.
793 // Note: You can use most Docking facilities without calling any API. You DO NOT need to call DockSpace() to use Docking!
794 // - Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to disable docking/undocking.
795 // - Drag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows).
796 // - When io.ConfigDockingWithShift == true, you instead need to hold SHIFT to _enable_ docking/undocking.
797 // About dockspaces:
798 // - Use DockSpace() to create an explicit dock node _within_ an existing window. See Docking demo for details.
799 // - Use DockSpaceOverViewport() to create an explicit dock node covering the screen or a specific viewport.
800 // This is often used with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode.
801 // - Important: Dockspaces need to be submitted _before_ any window they can host. Submit it early in your frame!
802 // - Important: Dockspaces need to be kept alive if hidden, otherwise windows docked into it will be undocked.
803 // e.g. if you have multiple tabs with a dockspace inside each tab: submit the non-visible dockspaces with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly.
804 IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockSpace(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0, const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class = NULL);
805 IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockSpaceOverViewport(const ImGuiViewport* viewport = NULL, ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0, const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class = NULL);
806 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowDockID(ImGuiID dock_id, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window dock id
807 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowClass(const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class); // set next window class (control docking compatibility + provide hints to platform backend via custom viewport flags and platform parent/child relationship)
808 IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetWindowDockID();
809 IMGUI_API bool IsWindowDocked(); // is current window docked into another window?
810
811 // Logging/Capture
812 // - All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard. By default, tree nodes are automatically opened during logging.
813 IMGUI_API void LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth = -1); // start logging to tty (stdout)
814 IMGUI_API void LogToFile(int auto_open_depth = -1, const char* filename = NULL); // start logging to file
815 IMGUI_API void LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth = -1); // start logging to OS clipboard
816 IMGUI_API void LogFinish(); // stop logging (close file, etc.)
817 IMGUI_API void LogButtons(); // helper to display buttons for logging to tty/file/clipboard
818 IMGUI_API void LogText(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
819 IMGUI_API void LogTextV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
820
821 // Drag and Drop
822 // - On source items, call BeginDragDropSource(), if it returns true also call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource().
823 // - On target candidates, call BeginDragDropTarget(), if it returns true also call AcceptDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropTarget().
824 // - If you stop calling BeginDragDropSource() the payload is preserved however it won't have a preview tooltip (we currently display a fallback "..." tooltip, see #1725)
825 // - An item can be both drag source and drop target.
826 IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags = 0); // call after submitting an item which may be dragged. when this return true, you can call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource()
827 IMGUI_API bool SetDragDropPayload(const char* type, const void* data, size_t sz, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // type is a user defined string of maximum 32 characters. Strings starting with '_' are reserved for dear imgui internal types. Data is copied and held by imgui. Return true when payload has been accepted.
828 IMGUI_API void EndDragDropSource(); // only call EndDragDropSource() if BeginDragDropSource() returns true!
829 IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropTarget(); // call after submitting an item that may receive a payload. If this returns true, you can call AcceptDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropTarget()
830 IMGUI_API const ImGuiPayload* AcceptDragDropPayload(const char* type, ImGuiDragDropFlags flags = 0); // accept contents of a given type. If ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery is set you can peek into the payload before the mouse button is released.
831 IMGUI_API void EndDragDropTarget(); // only call EndDragDropTarget() if BeginDragDropTarget() returns true!
832 IMGUI_API const ImGuiPayload* GetDragDropPayload(); // peek directly into the current payload from anywhere. may return NULL. use ImGuiPayload::IsDataType() to test for the payload type.
833
834 // Disabling [BETA API]
835 // - Disable all user interactions and dim items visuals (applying style.DisabledAlpha over current colors)
836 // - Those can be nested but it cannot be used to enable an already disabled section (a single BeginDisabled(true) in the stack is enough to keep everything disabled)
837 // - BeginDisabled(false) essentially does nothing useful but is provided to facilitate use of boolean expressions. If you can avoid calling BeginDisabled(False)/EndDisabled() best to avoid it.
838 IMGUI_API void BeginDisabled(bool disabled = true);
839 IMGUI_API void EndDisabled();
840
841 // Clipping
842 // - Mouse hovering is affected by ImGui::PushClipRect() calls, unlike direct calls to ImDrawList::PushClipRect() which are render only.
843 IMGUI_API void PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
844 IMGUI_API void PopClipRect();
845
846 // Focus, Activation
847 // - Prefer using "SetItemDefaultFocus()" over "if (IsWindowAppearing()) SetScrollHereY()" when applicable to signify "this is the default item"
848 IMGUI_API void SetItemDefaultFocus(); // make last item the default focused item of a window.
849 IMGUI_API void SetKeyboardFocusHere(int offset = 0); // focus keyboard on the next widget. Use positive 'offset' to access sub components of a multiple component widget. Use -1 to access previous widget.
850
851 // Item/Widgets Utilities and Query Functions
852 // - Most of the functions are referring to the previous Item that has been submitted.
853 // - See Demo Window under "Widgets->Querying Status" for an interactive visualization of most of those functions.
854 IMGUI_API bool IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags = 0); // is the last item hovered? (and usable, aka not blocked by a popup, etc.). See ImGuiHoveredFlags for more options.
855 IMGUI_API bool IsItemActive(); // is the last item active? (e.g. button being held, text field being edited. This will continuously return true while holding mouse button on an item. Items that don't interact will always return false)
856 IMGUI_API bool IsItemFocused(); // is the last item focused for keyboard/gamepad navigation?
857 IMGUI_API bool IsItemClicked(ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = 0); // is the last item hovered and mouse clicked on? (**) == IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered()Important. (**) this it NOT equivalent to the behavior of e.g. Button(). Read comments in function definition.
858 IMGUI_API bool IsItemVisible(); // is the last item visible? (items may be out of sight because of clipping/scrolling)
859 IMGUI_API bool IsItemEdited(); // did the last item modify its underlying value this frame? or was pressed? This is generally the same as the "bool" return value of many widgets.
860 IMGUI_API bool IsItemActivated(); // was the last item just made active (item was previously inactive).
861 IMGUI_API bool IsItemDeactivated(); // was the last item just made inactive (item was previously active). Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that requires continuous editing.
862 IMGUI_API bool IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(); // was the last item just made inactive and made a value change when it was active? (e.g. Slider/Drag moved). Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that requires continuous editing. Note that you may get false positives (some widgets such as Combo()/ListBox()/Selectable() will return true even when clicking an already selected item).
863 IMGUI_API bool IsItemToggledOpen(); // was the last item open state toggled? set by TreeNode().
864 IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemHovered(); // is any item hovered?
865 IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemActive(); // is any item active?
866 IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemFocused(); // is any item focused?
867 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectMin(); // get upper-left bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)
868 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectMax(); // get lower-right bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)
869 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectSize(); // get size of last item
870 IMGUI_API void SetItemAllowOverlap(); // allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. sometimes useful with invisible buttons, selectables, etc. to catch unused area.
871
872 // Viewports
873 // - Currently represents the Platform Window created by the application which is hosting our Dear ImGui windows.
874 // - In 'docking' branch with multi-viewport enabled, we extend this concept to have multiple active viewports.
875 // - In the future we will extend this concept further to also represent Platform Monitor and support a "no main platform window" operation mode.
876 IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport* GetMainViewport(); // return primary/default viewport. This can never be NULL.
877
878 // Background/Foreground Draw Lists
879 IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetBackgroundDrawList(); // get background draw list for the viewport associated to the current window. this draw list will be the first rendering one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text behind dear imgui contents.
880 IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetForegroundDrawList(); // get foreground draw list for the viewport associated to the current window. this draw list will be the last rendered one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text over dear imgui contents.
881 IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetBackgroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport); // get background draw list for the given viewport. this draw list will be the first rendering one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text behind dear imgui contents.
882 IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetForegroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport); // get foreground draw list for the given viewport. this draw list will be the last rendered one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text over dear imgui contents.
883
884 // Miscellaneous Utilities
885 IMGUI_API bool IsRectVisible(const ImVec2& size); // test if rectangle (of given size, starting from cursor position) is visible / not clipped.
886 IMGUI_API bool IsRectVisible(const ImVec2& rect_min, const ImVec2& rect_max); // test if rectangle (in screen space) is visible / not clipped. to perform coarse clipping on user's side.
887 IMGUI_API double GetTime(); // get global imgui time. incremented by io.DeltaTime every frame.
888 IMGUI_API int GetFrameCount(); // get global imgui frame count. incremented by 1 every frame.
889 IMGUI_API ImDrawListSharedData* GetDrawListSharedData(); // you may use this when creating your own ImDrawList instances.
890 IMGUI_API const char* GetStyleColorName(ImGuiCol idx); // get a string corresponding to the enum value (for display, saving, etc.).
891 IMGUI_API void SetStateStorage(ImGuiStorage* storage); // replace current window storage with our own (if you want to manipulate it yourself, typically clear subsection of it)
892 IMGUI_API ImGuiStorage* GetStateStorage();
893 IMGUI_API bool BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame
894 IMGUI_API void EndChildFrame(); // always call EndChildFrame() regardless of BeginChildFrame() return values (which indicates a collapsed/clipped window)
895
896 // Text Utilities
897 IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSize(const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL, bool hide_text_after_double_hash = false, float wrap_width = -1.0f);
898
899 // Color Utilities
900 IMGUI_API ImVec4 ColorConvertU32ToFloat4(ImU32 in);
901 IMGUI_API ImU32 ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(const ImVec4& in);
902 IMGUI_API void ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(float r, float g, float b, float& out_h, float& out_s, float& out_v);
903 IMGUI_API void ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(float h, float s, float v, float& out_r, float& out_g, float& out_b);
904
905 // Inputs Utilities: Keyboard
906 // Without IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO: (legacy support)
907 // - For 'ImGuiKey key' you can still use your legacy native/user indices according to how your backend/engine stored them in io.KeysDown[].
908 // With IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO: (this is the way forward)
909 // - Any use of 'ImGuiKey' will assert when key < 512 will be passed, previously reserved as native/user keys indices
910 // - GetKeyIndex() is pass-through and therefore deprecated (gone if IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO is defined)
911 IMGUI_API bool IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey key); // is key being held.
912 IMGUI_API bool IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey key, bool repeat = true); // was key pressed (went from !Down to Down)? if repeat=true, uses io.KeyRepeatDelay / KeyRepeatRate
913 IMGUI_API bool IsKeyReleased(ImGuiKey key); // was key released (went from Down to !Down)?
914 IMGUI_API int GetKeyPressedAmount(ImGuiKey key, float repeat_delay, float rate); // uses provided repeat rate/delay. return a count, most often 0 or 1 but might be >1 if RepeatRate is small enough that DeltaTime > RepeatRate
915 IMGUI_API const char* GetKeyName(ImGuiKey key); // [DEBUG] returns English name of the key. Those names a provided for debugging purpose and are not meant to be saved persistently not compared.
916 IMGUI_API void CaptureKeyboardFromApp(bool want_capture_keyboard_value = true); // attention: misleading name! manually override io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag next frame (said flag is entirely left for your application to handle). e.g. force capture keyboard when your widget is being hovered. This is equivalent to setting "io.WantCaptureKeyboard = want_capture_keyboard_value"; after the next NewFrame() call.
917
918 // Inputs Utilities: Mouse
919 // - To refer to a mouse button, you may use named enums in your code e.g. ImGuiMouseButton_Left, ImGuiMouseButton_Right.
920 // - You can also use regular integer: it is forever guaranteed that 0=Left, 1=Right, 2=Middle.
921 // - Dragging operations are only reported after mouse has moved a certain distance away from the initial clicking position (see 'lock_threshold' and 'io.MouseDraggingThreshold')
922 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button); // is mouse button held?
923 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, bool repeat = false); // did mouse button clicked? (went from !Down to Down). Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 1.
924 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button); // did mouse button released? (went from Down to !Down)
925 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button); // did mouse button double-clicked? Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 2. (note that a double-click will also report IsMouseClicked() == true)
926 IMGUI_API int GetMouseClickedCount(ImGuiMouseButton button); // return the number of successive mouse-clicks at the time where a click happen (otherwise 0).
927 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseHoveringRect(const ImVec2& r_min, const ImVec2& r_max, bool clip = true);// is mouse hovering given bounding rect (in screen space). clipped by current clipping settings, but disregarding of other consideration of focus/window ordering/popup-block.
928 IMGUI_API bool IsMousePosValid(const ImVec2* mouse_pos = NULL); // by convention we use (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote that there is no mouse available
929 IMGUI_API bool IsAnyMouseDown(); // [WILL OBSOLETE] is any mouse button held? This was designed for backends, but prefer having backend maintain a mask of held mouse buttons, because upcoming input queue system will make this invalid.
930 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetMousePos(); // shortcut to ImGui::GetIO().MousePos provided by user, to be consistent with other calls
931 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup(); // retrieve mouse position at the time of opening popup we have BeginPopup() into (helper to avoid user backing that value themselves)
932 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold = -1.0f); // is mouse dragging? (if lock_threshold < -1.0f, uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold)
933 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button = 0, float lock_threshold = -1.0f); // return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is pressed or was just released. This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least once (if lock_threshold < -1.0f, uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold)
934 IMGUI_API void ResetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button = 0); //
935 IMGUI_API ImGuiMouseCursor GetMouseCursor(); // get desired cursor type, reset in ImGui::NewFrame(), this is updated during the frame. valid before Render(). If you use software rendering by setting io.MouseDrawCursor ImGui will render those for you
936 IMGUI_API void SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor_type); // set desired cursor type
937 IMGUI_API void CaptureMouseFromApp(bool want_capture_mouse_value = true); // attention: misleading name! manually override io.WantCaptureMouse flag next frame (said flag is entirely left for your application to handle). This is equivalent to setting "io.WantCaptureMouse = want_capture_mouse_value;" after the next NewFrame() call.
938
939 // Clipboard Utilities
940 // - Also see the LogToClipboard() function to capture GUI into clipboard, or easily output text data to the clipboard.
941 IMGUI_API const char* GetClipboardText();
942 IMGUI_API void SetClipboardText(const char* text);
943
944 // Settings/.Ini Utilities
945 // - The disk functions are automatically called if io.IniFilename != NULL (default is "imgui.ini").
946 // - Set io.IniFilename to NULL to load/save manually. Read io.WantSaveIniSettings description about handling .ini saving manually.
947 // - Important: default value "imgui.ini" is relative to current working dir! Most apps will want to lock this to an absolute path (e.g. same path as executables).
948 IMGUI_API void LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(const char* ini_filename); // call after CreateContext() and before the first call to NewFrame(). NewFrame() automatically calls LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(io.IniFilename).
949 IMGUI_API void LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(const char* ini_data, size_t ini_size=0); // call after CreateContext() and before the first call to NewFrame() to provide .ini data from your own data source.
950 IMGUI_API void SaveIniSettingsToDisk(const char* ini_filename); // this is automatically called (if io.IniFilename is not empty) a few seconds after any modification that should be reflected in the .ini file (and also by DestroyContext).
951 IMGUI_API const char* SaveIniSettingsToMemory(size_t* out_ini_size = NULL); // return a zero-terminated string with the .ini data which you can save by your own mean. call when io.WantSaveIniSettings is set, then save data by your own mean and clear io.WantSaveIniSettings.
952
953 // Debug Utilities
954 // - This is used by the IMGUI_CHECKVERSION() macro.
955 IMGUI_API bool DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(const char* version_str, size_t sz_io, size_t sz_style, size_t sz_vec2, size_t sz_vec4, size_t sz_drawvert, size_t sz_drawidx); // This is called by IMGUI_CHECKVERSION() macro.
956
957 // Memory Allocators
958 // - Those functions are not reliant on the current context.
959 // - DLL users: heaps and globals are not shared across DLL boundaries! You will need to call SetCurrentContext() + SetAllocatorFunctions()
960 // for each static/DLL boundary you are calling from. Read "Context and Memory Allocators" section of imgui.cpp for more details.
961 IMGUI_API void SetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc free_func, void* user_data = NULL);
962 IMGUI_API void GetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc* p_alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc* p_free_func, void** p_user_data);
963 IMGUI_API void* MemAlloc(size_t size);
964 IMGUI_API void MemFree(void* ptr);
965
966 // (Optional) Platform/OS interface for multi-viewport support
967 // Read comments around the ImGuiPlatformIO structure for more details.
968 // Note: You may use GetWindowViewport() to get the current viewport of the current window.
969 IMGUI_API ImGuiPlatformIO& GetPlatformIO(); // platform/renderer functions, for backend to setup + viewports list.
970 IMGUI_API void UpdatePlatformWindows(); // call in main loop. will call CreateWindow/ResizeWindow/etc. platform functions for each secondary viewport, and DestroyWindow for each inactive viewport.
971 IMGUI_API void RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(void* platform_render_arg = NULL, void* renderer_render_arg = NULL); // call in main loop. will call RenderWindow/SwapBuffers platform functions for each secondary viewport which doesn't have the ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized flag set. May be reimplemented by user for custom rendering needs.
972 IMGUI_API void DestroyPlatformWindows(); // call DestroyWindow platform functions for all viewports. call from backend Shutdown() if you need to close platform windows before imgui shutdown. otherwise will be called by DestroyContext().
973 IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport* FindViewportByID(ImGuiID id); // this is a helper for backends.
974 IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport* FindViewportByPlatformHandle(void* platform_handle); // this is a helper for backends. the type platform_handle is decided by the backend (e.g. HWND, MyWindow*, GLFWwindow* etc.)
975
976} // namespace ImGui
977
978//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
979// [SECTION] Flags & Enumerations
980//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
981
982// Flags for ImGui::Begin()
983enum ImGuiWindowFlags_
984{
985 ImGuiWindowFlags_None = 0,
986 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar = 1 << 0, // Disable title-bar
987 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize = 1 << 1, // Disable user resizing with the lower-right grip
988 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove = 1 << 2, // Disable user moving the window
989 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar = 1 << 3, // Disable scrollbars (window can still scroll with mouse or programmatically)
990 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse = 1 << 4, // Disable user vertically scrolling with mouse wheel. On child window, mouse wheel will be forwarded to the parent unless NoScrollbar is also set.
991 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse = 1 << 5, // Disable user collapsing window by double-clicking on it. Also referred to as Window Menu Button (e.g. within a docking node).
992 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize = 1 << 6, // Resize every window to its content every frame
993 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground = 1 << 7, // Disable drawing background color (WindowBg, etc.) and outside border. Similar as using SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f).
994 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings = 1 << 8, // Never load/save settings in .ini file
995 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs = 1 << 9, // Disable catching mouse, hovering test with pass through.
996 ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar = 1 << 10, // Has a menu-bar
997 ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar = 1 << 11, // Allow horizontal scrollbar to appear (off by default). You may use SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(width,0.0f)); prior to calling Begin() to specify width. Read code in imgui_demo in the "Horizontal Scrolling" section.
998 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing = 1 << 12, // Disable taking focus when transitioning from hidden to visible state
999 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus = 1 << 13, // Disable bringing window to front when taking focus (e.g. clicking on it or programmatically giving it focus)
1000 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar= 1 << 14, // Always show vertical scrollbar (even if ContentSize.y < Size.y)
1001 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar=1<< 15, // Always show horizontal scrollbar (even if ContentSize.x < Size.x)
1002 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding = 1 << 16, // Ensure child windows without border uses style.WindowPadding (ignored by default for non-bordered child windows, because more convenient)
1003 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs = 1 << 18, // No gamepad/keyboard navigation within the window
1004 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus = 1 << 19, // No focusing toward this window with gamepad/keyboard navigation (e.g. skipped by CTRL+TAB)
1005 ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument = 1 << 20, // Display a dot next to the title. When used in a tab/docking context, tab is selected when clicking the X + closure is not assumed (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab). Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar.
1006 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking = 1 << 21, // Disable docking of this window
1007
1008 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus,
1009 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse,
1010 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus,
1011
1012 // [Internal]
1013 ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened = 1 << 23, // [BETA] On child window: allow gamepad/keyboard navigation to cross over parent border to this child or between sibling child windows.
1014 ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow = 1 << 24, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginChild()
1015 ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip = 1 << 25, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginTooltip()
1016 ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup = 1 << 26, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginPopup()
1017 ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal = 1 << 27, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginPopupModal()
1018 ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu = 1 << 28, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginMenu()
1019 ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost = 1 << 29 // Don't use! For internal use by Begin()/NewFrame()
1020
1021 // [Obsolete]
1022 //ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide = 1 << 17, // [Obsolete] --> Set io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges=true and make sure mouse cursors are supported by backend (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors)
1023};
1024
1025// Flags for ImGui::InputText()
1026enum ImGuiInputTextFlags_
1027{
1028 ImGuiInputTextFlags_None = 0,
1029 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal = 1 << 0, // Allow 0123456789.+-*/
1030 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal = 1 << 1, // Allow 0123456789ABCDEFabcdef
1031 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase = 1 << 2, // Turn a..z into A..Z
1032 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank = 1 << 3, // Filter out spaces, tabs
1033 ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll = 1 << 4, // Select entire text when first taking mouse focus
1034 ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue = 1 << 5, // Return 'true' when Enter is pressed (as opposed to every time the value was modified). Consider looking at the IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() function.
1035 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion = 1 << 6, // Callback on pressing TAB (for completion handling)
1036 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory = 1 << 7, // Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows (for history handling)
1037 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways = 1 << 8, // Callback on each iteration. User code may query cursor position, modify text buffer.
1038 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter = 1 << 9, // Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard, or return 1 in callback to discard.
1039 ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput = 1 << 10, // Pressing TAB input a '\t' character into the text field
1040 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine = 1 << 11, // In multi-line mode, unfocus with Enter, add new line with Ctrl+Enter (default is opposite: unfocus with Ctrl+Enter, add line with Enter).
1041 ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoHorizontalScroll = 1 << 12, // Disable following the cursor horizontally
1042 ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite = 1 << 13, // Overwrite mode
1043 ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly = 1 << 14, // Read-only mode
1044 ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password = 1 << 15, // Password mode, display all characters as '*'
1045 ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo = 1 << 16, // Disable undo/redo. Note that input text owns the text data while active, if you want to provide your own undo/redo stack you need e.g. to call ClearActiveID().
1046 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific = 1 << 17, // Allow 0123456789.+-*/eE (Scientific notation input)
1047 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize = 1 << 18, // Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter value), allowing the string to grow. Notify when the string wants to be resized (for string types which hold a cache of their Size). You will be provided a new BufSize in the callback and NEED to honor it. (see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an example of using this)
1048 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit = 1 << 19 // Callback on any edit (note that InputText() already returns true on edit, the callback is useful mainly to manipulate the underlying buffer while focus is active)
1049
1050 // Obsolete names (will be removed soon)
1051#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1052 , ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysInsertMode = ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite // [renamed in 1.82] name was not matching behavior
1053#endif
1054};
1055
1056// Flags for ImGui::TreeNodeEx(), ImGui::CollapsingHeader*()
1057enum ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_
1058{
1059 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None = 0,
1060 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected = 1 << 0, // Draw as selected
1061 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed = 1 << 1, // Draw frame with background (e.g. for CollapsingHeader)
1062 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap = 1 << 2, // Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one
1063 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen = 1 << 3, // Don't do a TreePush() when open (e.g. for CollapsingHeader) = no extra indent nor pushing on ID stack
1064 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog = 1 << 4, // Don't automatically and temporarily open node when Logging is active (by default logging will automatically open tree nodes)
1065 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen = 1 << 5, // Default node to be open
1066 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick = 1 << 6, // Need double-click to open node
1067 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow = 1 << 7, // Only open when clicking on the arrow part. If ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick is also set, single-click arrow or double-click all box to open.
1068 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf = 1 << 8, // No collapsing, no arrow (use as a convenience for leaf nodes).
1069 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet = 1 << 9, // Display a bullet instead of arrow
1070 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_FramePadding = 1 << 10, // Use FramePadding (even for an unframed text node) to vertically align text baseline to regular widget height. Equivalent to calling AlignTextToFramePadding().
1071 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth = 1 << 11, // Extend hit box to the right-most edge, even if not framed. This is not the default in order to allow adding other items on the same line. In the future we may refactor the hit system to be front-to-back, allowing natural overlaps and then this can become the default.
1072 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth = 1 << 12, // Extend hit box to the left-most and right-most edges (bypass the indented area).
1073 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere = 1 << 13, // (WIP) Nav: left direction may move to this TreeNode() from any of its child (items submitted between TreeNode and TreePop)
1074 //ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoScrollOnOpen = 1 << 14, // FIXME: TODO: Disable automatic scroll on TreePop() if node got just open and contents is not visible
1075 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog
1076};
1077
1078// Flags for OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(), IsPopupOpen() functions.
1079// - To be backward compatible with older API which took an 'int mouse_button = 1' argument, we need to treat
1080// small flags values as a mouse button index, so we encode the mouse button in the first few bits of the flags.
1081// It is therefore guaranteed to be legal to pass a mouse button index in ImGuiPopupFlags.
1082// - For the same reason, we exceptionally default the ImGuiPopupFlags argument of BeginPopupContextXXX functions to 1 instead of 0.
1083// IMPORTANT: because the default parameter is 1 (==ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight), if you rely on the default parameter
1084// and want to another another flag, you need to pass in the ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight flag.
1085// - Multiple buttons currently cannot be combined/or-ed in those functions (we could allow it later).
1086enum ImGuiPopupFlags_
1087{
1088 ImGuiPopupFlags_None = 0,
1089 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonLeft = 0, // For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Left Mouse release. Guaranteed to always be == 0 (same as ImGuiMouseButton_Left)
1090 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight = 1, // For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Right Mouse release. Guaranteed to always be == 1 (same as ImGuiMouseButton_Right)
1091 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMiddle = 2, // For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Middle Mouse release. Guaranteed to always be == 2 (same as ImGuiMouseButton_Middle)
1092 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_ = 0x1F,
1093 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonDefault_ = 1,
1094 ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup = 1 << 5, // For OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(): don't open if there's already a popup at the same level of the popup stack
1095 ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems = 1 << 6, // For BeginPopupContextWindow(): don't return true when hovering items, only when hovering empty space
1096 ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId = 1 << 7, // For IsPopupOpen(): ignore the ImGuiID parameter and test for any popup.
1097 ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel = 1 << 8, // For IsPopupOpen(): search/test at any level of the popup stack (default test in the current level)
1098 ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopup = ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId | ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel
1099};
1100
1101// Flags for ImGui::Selectable()
1102enum ImGuiSelectableFlags_
1103{
1104 ImGuiSelectableFlags_None = 0,
1105 ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups = 1 << 0, // Clicking this don't close parent popup window
1106 ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns = 1 << 1, // Selectable frame can span all columns (text will still fit in current column)
1107 ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowDoubleClick = 1 << 2, // Generate press events on double clicks too
1108 ImGuiSelectableFlags_Disabled = 1 << 3, // Cannot be selected, display grayed out text
1109 ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap = 1 << 4 // (WIP) Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one
1110};
1111
1112// Flags for ImGui::BeginCombo()
1113enum ImGuiComboFlags_
1114{
1115 ImGuiComboFlags_None = 0,
1116 ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft = 1 << 0, // Align the popup toward the left by default
1117 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall = 1 << 1, // Max ~4 items visible. Tip: If you want your combo popup to be a specific size you can use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() prior to calling BeginCombo()
1118 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular = 1 << 2, // Max ~8 items visible (default)
1119 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge = 1 << 3, // Max ~20 items visible
1120 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest = 1 << 4, // As many fitting items as possible
1121 ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton = 1 << 5, // Display on the preview box without the square arrow button
1122 ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview = 1 << 6, // Display only a square arrow button
1123 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_ = ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest
1124};
1125
1126// Flags for ImGui::BeginTabBar()
1127enum ImGuiTabBarFlags_
1128{
1129 ImGuiTabBarFlags_None = 0,
1130 ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable = 1 << 0, // Allow manually dragging tabs to re-order them + New tabs are appended at the end of list
1131 ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs = 1 << 1, // Automatically select new tabs when they appear
1132 ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton = 1 << 2, // Disable buttons to open the tab list popup
1133 ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton = 1 << 3, // Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != NULL) with middle mouse button. You can still repro this behavior on user's side with if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2)) *p_open = false.
1134 ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTabListScrollingButtons = 1 << 4, // Disable scrolling buttons (apply when fitting policy is ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll)
1135 ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTooltip = 1 << 5, // Disable tooltips when hovering a tab
1136 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown = 1 << 6, // Resize tabs when they don't fit
1137 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll = 1 << 7, // Add scroll buttons when tabs don't fit
1138 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ = ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown | ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll,
1139 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_ = ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown
1140};
1141
1142// Flags for ImGui::BeginTabItem()
1143enum ImGuiTabItemFlags_
1144{
1145 ImGuiTabItemFlags_None = 0,
1146 ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument = 1 << 0, // Display a dot next to the title + tab is selected when clicking the X + closure is not assumed (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab). Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar.
1147 ImGuiTabItemFlags_SetSelected = 1 << 1, // Trigger flag to programmatically make the tab selected when calling BeginTabItem()
1148 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton = 1 << 2, // Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != NULL) with middle mouse button. You can still repro this behavior on user's side with if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2)) *p_open = false.
1149 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId = 1 << 3, // Don't call PushID(tab->ID)/PopID() on BeginTabItem()/EndTabItem()
1150 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoTooltip = 1 << 4, // Disable tooltip for the given tab
1151 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder = 1 << 5, // Disable reordering this tab or having another tab cross over this tab
1152 ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading = 1 << 6, // Enforce the tab position to the left of the tab bar (after the tab list popup button)
1153 ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing = 1 << 7 // Enforce the tab position to the right of the tab bar (before the scrolling buttons)
1154};
1155
1156// Flags for ImGui::BeginTable()
1157// - Important! Sizing policies have complex and subtle side effects, much more so than you would expect.
1158// Read comments/demos carefully + experiment with live demos to get acquainted with them.
1159// - The DEFAULT sizing policies are:
1160// - Default to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit if ScrollX is on, or if host window has ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize.
1161// - Default to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame if ScrollX is off.
1162// - When ScrollX is off:
1163// - Table defaults to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame -> all Columns defaults to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch with same weight.
1164// - Columns sizing policy allowed: Stretch (default), Fixed/Auto.
1165// - Fixed Columns (if any) will generally obtain their requested width (unless the table cannot fit them all).
1166// - Stretch Columns will share the remaining width according to their respective weight.
1167// - Mixed Fixed/Stretch columns is possible but has various side-effects on resizing behaviors.
1168// The typical use of mixing sizing policies is: any number of LEADING Fixed columns, followed by one or two TRAILING Stretch columns.
1169// (this is because the visible order of columns have subtle but necessary effects on how they react to manual resizing).
1170// - When ScrollX is on:
1171// - Table defaults to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit -> all Columns defaults to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed
1172// - Columns sizing policy allowed: Fixed/Auto mostly.
1173// - Fixed Columns can be enlarged as needed. Table will show an horizontal scrollbar if needed.
1174// - When using auto-resizing (non-resizable) fixed columns, querying the content width to use item right-alignment e.g. SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN) doesn't make sense, would create a feedback loop.
1175// - Using Stretch columns OFTEN DOES NOT MAKE SENSE if ScrollX is on, UNLESS you have specified a value for 'inner_width' in BeginTable().
1176// If you specify a value for 'inner_width' then effectively the scrolling space is known and Stretch or mixed Fixed/Stretch columns become meaningful again.
1177// - Read on documentation at the top of imgui_tables.cpp for details.
1178enum ImGuiTableFlags_
1179{
1180 // Features
1181 ImGuiTableFlags_None = 0,
1182 ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable = 1 << 0, // Enable resizing columns.
1183 ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable = 1 << 1, // Enable reordering columns in header row (need calling TableSetupColumn() + TableHeadersRow() to display headers)
1184 ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable = 1 << 2, // Enable hiding/disabling columns in context menu.
1185 ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable = 1 << 3, // Enable sorting. Call TableGetSortSpecs() to obtain sort specs. Also see ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti and ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate.
1186 ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings = 1 << 4, // Disable persisting columns order, width and sort settings in the .ini file.
1187 ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody = 1 << 5, // Right-click on columns body/contents will display table context menu. By default it is available in TableHeadersRow().
1188 // Decorations
1189 ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg = 1 << 6, // Set each RowBg color with ImGuiCol_TableRowBg or ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt (equivalent of calling TableSetBgColor with ImGuiTableBgFlags_RowBg0 on each row manually)
1190 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH = 1 << 7, // Draw horizontal borders between rows.
1191 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH = 1 << 8, // Draw horizontal borders at the top and bottom.
1192 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV = 1 << 9, // Draw vertical borders between columns.
1193 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV = 1 << 10, // Draw vertical borders on the left and right sides.
1194 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH, // Draw horizontal borders.
1195 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV, // Draw vertical borders.
1196 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH, // Draw inner borders.
1197 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH, // Draw outer borders.
1198 ImGuiTableFlags_Borders = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter, // Draw all borders.
1199 ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody = 1 << 11, // [ALPHA] Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appears in Headers). -> May move to style
1200 ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize = 1 << 12, // [ALPHA] Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appears in Headers). -> May move to style
1201 // Sizing Policy (read above for defaults)
1202 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit = 1 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable), matching contents width.
1203 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame = 2 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable), matching the maximum contents width of all columns. Implicitly enable ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible.
1204 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp = 3 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights proportional to each columns contents widths.
1205 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame = 4 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights all equal, unless overridden by TableSetupColumn().
1206 // Sizing Extra Options
1207 ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX = 1 << 16, // Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value. Only available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.
1208 ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY = 1 << 17, // Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit). Only available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.
1209 ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible = 1 << 18, // Disable keeping column always minimally visible when ScrollX is off and table gets too small. Not recommended if columns are resizable.
1210 ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths = 1 << 19, // Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.
1211 // Clipping
1212 ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip = 1 << 20, // Disable clipping rectangle for every individual columns (reduce draw command count, items will be able to overflow into other columns). Generally incompatible with TableSetupScrollFreeze().
1213 // Padding
1214 ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX = 1 << 21, // Default if BordersOuterV is on. Enable outer-most padding. Generally desirable if you have headers.
1215 ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX = 1 << 22, // Default if BordersOuterV is off. Disable outer-most padding.
1216 ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX = 1 << 23, // Disable inner padding between columns (double inner padding if BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off).
1217 // Scrolling
1218 ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX = 1 << 24, // Enable horizontal scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable() to specify the container size. Changes default sizing policy. Because this create a child window, ScrollY is currently generally recommended when using ScrollX.
1219 ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY = 1 << 25, // Enable vertical scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable() to specify the container size.
1220 // Sorting
1221 ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti = 1 << 26, // Hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).
1222 ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate = 1 << 27, // Allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).
1223
1224 // [Internal] Combinations and masks
1225 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_ = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame
1226
1227 // Obsolete names (will be removed soon)
1228#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1229 //, ImGuiTableFlags_ColumnsWidthFixed = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImGuiTableFlags_ColumnsWidthStretch = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame // WIP Tables 2020/12
1230 //, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingPolicyFixed = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingPolicyStretch = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame // WIP Tables 2021/01
1231#endif
1232};
1233
1234// Flags for ImGui::TableSetupColumn()
1235enum ImGuiTableColumnFlags_
1236{
1237 // Input configuration flags
1238 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None = 0,
1239 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_Disabled = 1 << 0, // Overriding/master disable flag: hide column, won't show in context menu (unlike calling TableSetColumnEnabled() which manipulates the user accessible state)
1240 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide = 1 << 1, // Default as a hidden/disabled column.
1241 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort = 1 << 2, // Default as a sorting column.
1242 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch = 1 << 3, // Column will stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling disabled (default if table sizing policy is _SizingStretchSame or _SizingStretchProp).
1243 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed = 1 << 4, // Column will not stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling enabled (default if table sizing policy is _SizingFixedFit and table is resizable).
1244 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoResize = 1 << 5, // Disable manual resizing.
1245 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoReorder = 1 << 6, // Disable manual reordering this column, this will also prevent other columns from crossing over this column.
1246 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide = 1 << 7, // Disable ability to hide/disable this column.
1247 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoClip = 1 << 8, // Disable clipping for this column (all NoClip columns will render in a same draw command).
1248 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort = 1 << 9, // Disable ability to sort on this field (even if ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable is set on the table).
1249 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending = 1 << 10, // Disable ability to sort in the ascending direction.
1250 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending = 1 << 11, // Disable ability to sort in the descending direction.
1251 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderLabel = 1 << 12, // TableHeadersRow() will not submit label for this column. Convenient for some small columns. Name will still appear in context menu.
1252 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderWidth = 1 << 13, // Disable header text width contribution to automatic column width.
1253 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending = 1 << 14, // Make the initial sort direction Ascending when first sorting on this column (default).
1254 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending = 1 << 15, // Make the initial sort direction Descending when first sorting on this column.
1255 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable = 1 << 16, // Use current Indent value when entering cell (default for column 0).
1256 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable = 1 << 17, // Ignore current Indent value when entering cell (default for columns > 0). Indentation changes _within_ the cell will still be honored.
1257
1258 // Output status flags, read-only via TableGetColumnFlags()
1259 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled = 1 << 24, // Status: is enabled == not hidden by user/api (referred to as "Hide" in _DefaultHide and _NoHide) flags.
1260 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible = 1 << 25, // Status: is visible == is enabled AND not clipped by scrolling.
1261 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted = 1 << 26, // Status: is currently part of the sort specs
1262 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered = 1 << 27, // Status: is hovered by mouse
1263
1264 // [Internal] Combinations and masks
1265 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed,
1266 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable,
1267 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_StatusMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered,
1268 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoDirectResize_ = 1 << 30 // [Internal] Disable user resizing this column directly (it may however we resized indirectly from its left edge)
1269
1270 // Obsolete names (will be removed soon)
1271#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1272 //ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthAuto = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoResize, // Column will not stretch and keep resizing based on submitted contents.
1273#endif
1274};
1275
1276// Flags for ImGui::TableNextRow()
1277enum ImGuiTableRowFlags_
1278{
1279 ImGuiTableRowFlags_None = 0,
1280 ImGuiTableRowFlags_Headers = 1 << 0 // Identify header row (set default background color + width of its contents accounted differently for auto column width)
1281};
1282
1283// Enum for ImGui::TableSetBgColor()
1284// Background colors are rendering in 3 layers:
1285// - Layer 0: draw with RowBg0 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg0 if set.
1286// - Layer 1: draw with RowBg1 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg1 if set.
1287// - Layer 2: draw with CellBg color if set.
1288// The purpose of the two row/columns layers is to let you decide if a background color changes should override or blend with the existing color.
1289// When using ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg on the table, each row has the RowBg0 color automatically set for odd/even rows.
1290// If you set the color of RowBg0 target, your color will override the existing RowBg0 color.
1291// If you set the color of RowBg1 or ColumnBg1 target, your color will blend over the RowBg0 color.
1292enum ImGuiTableBgTarget_
1293{
1294 ImGuiTableBgTarget_None = 0,
1295 ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg0 = 1, // Set row background color 0 (generally used for background, automatically set when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is used)
1296 ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg1 = 2, // Set row background color 1 (generally used for selection marking)
1297 ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg = 3 // Set cell background color (top-most color)
1298};
1299
1300// Flags for ImGui::IsWindowFocused()
1301enum ImGuiFocusedFlags_
1302{
1303 ImGuiFocusedFlags_None = 0,
1304 ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows = 1 << 0, // Return true if any children of the window is focused
1305 ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow = 1 << 1, // Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
1306 ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow = 1 << 2, // Return true if any window is focused. Important: If you are trying to tell how to dispatch your low-level inputs, do NOT use this. Use 'io.WantCaptureMouse' instead! Please read the FAQ!
1307 ImGuiFocusedFlags_NoPopupHierarchy = 1 << 3, // Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup emitter as parent of popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
1308 ImGuiFocusedFlags_DockHierarchy = 1 << 4, // Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as parent of docked window) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
1309 ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootAndChildWindows = ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows
1310};
1311
1312// Flags for ImGui::IsItemHovered(), ImGui::IsWindowHovered()
1313// Note: if you are trying to check whether your mouse should be dispatched to Dear ImGui or to your app, you should use 'io.WantCaptureMouse' instead! Please read the FAQ!
1314// Note: windows with the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs flag are ignored by IsWindowHovered() calls.
1315enum ImGuiHoveredFlags_
1316{
1317 ImGuiHoveredFlags_None = 0, // Return true if directly over the item/window, not obstructed by another window, not obstructed by an active popup or modal blocking inputs under them.
1318 ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows = 1 << 0, // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any children of the window is hovered
1319 ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow = 1 << 1, // IsWindowHovered() only: Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
1320 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow = 1 << 2, // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any window is hovered
1321 ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy = 1 << 3, // IsWindowHovered() only: Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup emitter as parent of popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
1322 ImGuiHoveredFlags_DockHierarchy = 1 << 4, // IsWindowHovered() only: Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as parent of docked window) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
1323 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup = 1 << 5, // Return true even if a popup window is normally blocking access to this item/window
1324 //ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByModal = 1 << 6, // Return true even if a modal popup window is normally blocking access to this item/window. FIXME-TODO: Unavailable yet.
1325 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem = 1 << 7, // Return true even if an active item is blocking access to this item/window. Useful for Drag and Drop patterns.
1326 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped = 1 << 8, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the position is obstructed or overlapped by another window
1327 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled = 1 << 9, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the item is disabled
1328 ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoNavOverride = 1 << 10, // Disable using gamepad/keyboard navigation state when active, always query mouse.
1329 ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly = ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped,
1330 ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootAndChildWindows = ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows
1331};
1332
1333// Flags for ImGui::DockSpace(), shared/inherited by child nodes.
1334// (Some flags can be applied to individual nodes directly)
1335// FIXME-DOCK: Also see ImGuiDockNodeFlagsPrivate_ which may involve using the WIP and internal DockBuilder api.
1336enum ImGuiDockNodeFlags_
1337{
1338 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None = 0,
1339 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly = 1 << 0, // Shared // Don't display the dockspace node but keep it alive. Windows docked into this dockspace node won't be undocked.
1340 //ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCentralNode = 1 << 1, // Shared // Disable Central Node (the node which can stay empty)
1341 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingInCentralNode = 1 << 2, // Shared // Disable docking inside the Central Node, which will be always kept empty.
1342 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode = 1 << 3, // Shared // Enable passthru dockspace: 1) DockSpace() will render a ImGuiCol_WindowBg background covering everything excepted the Central Node when empty. Meaning the host window should probably use SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f) prior to Begin() when using this. 2) When Central Node is empty: let inputs pass-through + won't display a DockingEmptyBg background. See demo for details.
1343 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoSplit = 1 << 4, // Shared/Local // Disable splitting the node into smaller nodes. Useful e.g. when embedding dockspaces into a main root one (the root one may have splitting disabled to reduce confusion). Note: when turned off, existing splits will be preserved.
1344 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize = 1 << 5, // Shared/Local // Disable resizing node using the splitter/separators. Useful with programmatically setup dockspaces.
1345 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar = 1 << 6 // Shared/Local // Tab bar will automatically hide when there is a single window in the dock node.
1346};
1347
1348// Flags for ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(), ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload()
1349enum ImGuiDragDropFlags_
1350{
1351 ImGuiDragDropFlags_None = 0,
1352 // BeginDragDropSource() flags
1353 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip = 1 << 0, // By default, a successful call to BeginDragDropSource opens a tooltip so you can display a preview or description of the source contents. This flag disable this behavior.
1354 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover = 1 << 1, // By default, when dragging we clear data so that IsItemHovered() will return false, to avoid subsequent user code submitting tooltips. This flag disable this behavior so you can still call IsItemHovered() on the source item.
1355 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers = 1 << 2, // Disable the behavior that allows to open tree nodes and collapsing header by holding over them while dragging a source item.
1356 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID = 1 << 3, // Allow items such as Text(), Image() that have no unique identifier to be used as drag source, by manufacturing a temporary identifier based on their window-relative position. This is extremely unusual within the dear imgui ecosystem and so we made it explicit.
1357 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern = 1 << 4, // External source (from outside of dear imgui), won't attempt to read current item/window info. Will always return true. Only one Extern source can be active simultaneously.
1358 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload = 1 << 5, // Automatically expire the payload if the source cease to be submitted (otherwise payloads are persisting while being dragged)
1359 // AcceptDragDropPayload() flags
1360 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery = 1 << 10, // AcceptDragDropPayload() will returns true even before the mouse button is released. You can then call IsDelivery() to test if the payload needs to be delivered.
1361 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect = 1 << 11, // Do not draw the default highlight rectangle when hovering over target.
1362 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip = 1 << 12, // Request hiding the BeginDragDropSource tooltip from the BeginDragDropTarget site.
1363 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly = ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery | ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect // For peeking ahead and inspecting the payload before delivery.
1364};
1365
1366// Standard Drag and Drop payload types. You can define you own payload types using short strings. Types starting with '_' are defined by Dear ImGui.
1367#define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F "_COL3F" // float[3]: Standard type for colors, without alpha. User code may use this type.
1368#define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F "_COL4F" // float[4]: Standard type for colors. User code may use this type.
1369
1370// A primary data type
1371enum ImGuiDataType_
1372{
1373 ImGuiDataType_S8, // signed char / char (with sensible compilers)
1374 ImGuiDataType_U8, // unsigned char
1375 ImGuiDataType_S16, // short
1376 ImGuiDataType_U16, // unsigned short
1377 ImGuiDataType_S32, // int
1378 ImGuiDataType_U32, // unsigned int
1379 ImGuiDataType_S64, // long long / __int64
1380 ImGuiDataType_U64, // unsigned long long / unsigned __int64
1381 ImGuiDataType_Float, // float
1382 ImGuiDataType_Double, // double
1383 ImGuiDataType_COUNT
1384};
1385
1386// A cardinal direction
1387enum ImGuiDir_
1388{
1389 ImGuiDir_None = -1,
1390 ImGuiDir_Left = 0,
1391 ImGuiDir_Right = 1,
1392 ImGuiDir_Up = 2,
1393 ImGuiDir_Down = 3,
1394 ImGuiDir_COUNT
1395};
1396
1397// A sorting direction
1398enum ImGuiSortDirection_
1399{
1400 ImGuiSortDirection_None = 0,
1401 ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending = 1, // Ascending = 0->9, A->Z etc.
1402 ImGuiSortDirection_Descending = 2 // Descending = 9->0, Z->A etc.
1403};
1404
1405enum ImGuiKey_
1406{
1407 // Keyboard
1408 ImGuiKey_None = 0,
1409 ImGuiKey_Tab = 512, // == ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN
1410 ImGuiKey_LeftArrow,
1411 ImGuiKey_RightArrow,
1412 ImGuiKey_UpArrow,
1413 ImGuiKey_DownArrow,
1414 ImGuiKey_PageUp,
1415 ImGuiKey_PageDown,
1416 ImGuiKey_Home,
1417 ImGuiKey_End,
1418 ImGuiKey_Insert,
1419 ImGuiKey_Delete,
1420 ImGuiKey_Backspace,
1421 ImGuiKey_Space,
1422 ImGuiKey_Enter,
1423 ImGuiKey_Escape,
1424 ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl, ImGuiKey_LeftShift, ImGuiKey_LeftAlt, ImGuiKey_LeftSuper,
1425 ImGuiKey_RightCtrl, ImGuiKey_RightShift, ImGuiKey_RightAlt, ImGuiKey_RightSuper,
1426 ImGuiKey_Menu,
1427 ImGuiKey_0, ImGuiKey_1, ImGuiKey_2, ImGuiKey_3, ImGuiKey_4, ImGuiKey_5, ImGuiKey_6, ImGuiKey_7, ImGuiKey_8, ImGuiKey_9,
1428 ImGuiKey_A, ImGuiKey_B, ImGuiKey_C, ImGuiKey_D, ImGuiKey_E, ImGuiKey_F, ImGuiKey_G, ImGuiKey_H, ImGuiKey_I, ImGuiKey_J,
1429 ImGuiKey_K, ImGuiKey_L, ImGuiKey_M, ImGuiKey_N, ImGuiKey_O, ImGuiKey_P, ImGuiKey_Q, ImGuiKey_R, ImGuiKey_S, ImGuiKey_T,
1430 ImGuiKey_U, ImGuiKey_V, ImGuiKey_W, ImGuiKey_X, ImGuiKey_Y, ImGuiKey_Z,
1431 ImGuiKey_F1, ImGuiKey_F2, ImGuiKey_F3, ImGuiKey_F4, ImGuiKey_F5, ImGuiKey_F6,
1432 ImGuiKey_F7, ImGuiKey_F8, ImGuiKey_F9, ImGuiKey_F10, ImGuiKey_F11, ImGuiKey_F12,
1433 ImGuiKey_Apostrophe, // '
1434 ImGuiKey_Comma, // ,
1435 ImGuiKey_Minus, // -
1436 ImGuiKey_Period, // .
1437 ImGuiKey_Slash, // /
1438 ImGuiKey_Semicolon, // ;
1439 ImGuiKey_Equal, // =
1440 ImGuiKey_LeftBracket, // [
1441 ImGuiKey_Backslash, // \ (this text inhibit multiline comment caused by backslash)
1442 ImGuiKey_RightBracket, // ]
1443 ImGuiKey_GraveAccent, // `
1444 ImGuiKey_CapsLock,
1445 ImGuiKey_ScrollLock,
1446 ImGuiKey_NumLock,
1447 ImGuiKey_PrintScreen,
1448 ImGuiKey_Pause,
1449 ImGuiKey_Keypad0, ImGuiKey_Keypad1, ImGuiKey_Keypad2, ImGuiKey_Keypad3, ImGuiKey_Keypad4,
1450 ImGuiKey_Keypad5, ImGuiKey_Keypad6, ImGuiKey_Keypad7, ImGuiKey_Keypad8, ImGuiKey_Keypad9,
1451 ImGuiKey_KeypadDecimal,
1452 ImGuiKey_KeypadDivide,
1453 ImGuiKey_KeypadMultiply,
1454 ImGuiKey_KeypadSubtract,
1455 ImGuiKey_KeypadAdd,
1456 ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter,
1457 ImGuiKey_KeypadEqual,
1458
1459 // Gamepad (some of those are analog values, 0.0f to 1.0f) // NAVIGATION action
1460 ImGuiKey_GamepadStart, // Menu (Xbox) + (Switch) Start/Options (PS) // --
1461 ImGuiKey_GamepadBack, // View (Xbox) - (Switch) Share (PS) // --
1462 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceUp, // Y (Xbox) X (Switch) Triangle (PS) // -> ImGuiNavInput_Input
1463 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown, // A (Xbox) B (Switch) Cross (PS) // -> ImGuiNavInput_Activate
1464 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceLeft, // X (Xbox) Y (Switch) Square (PS) // -> ImGuiNavInput_Menu
1465 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight, // B (Xbox) A (Switch) Circle (PS) // -> ImGuiNavInput_Cancel
1466 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp, // D-pad Up // -> ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp
1467 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown, // D-pad Down // -> ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown
1468 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft, // D-pad Left // -> ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft
1469 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight, // D-pad Right // -> ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight
1470 ImGuiKey_GamepadL1, // L Bumper (Xbox) L (Switch) L1 (PS) // -> ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev + ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow
1471 ImGuiKey_GamepadR1, // R Bumper (Xbox) R (Switch) R1 (PS) // -> ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext + ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast
1472 ImGuiKey_GamepadL2, // L Trigger (Xbox) ZL (Switch) L2 (PS) [Analog]
1473 ImGuiKey_GamepadR2, // R Trigger (Xbox) ZR (Switch) R2 (PS) [Analog]
1474 ImGuiKey_GamepadL3, // L Thumbstick (Xbox) L3 (Switch) L3 (PS)
1475 ImGuiKey_GamepadR3, // R Thumbstick (Xbox) R3 (Switch) R3 (PS)
1476 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickUp, // [Analog] // -> ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp
1477 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickDown, // [Analog] // -> ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown
1478 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickLeft, // [Analog] // -> ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft
1479 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickRight, // [Analog] // -> ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight
1480 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickUp, // [Analog]
1481 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickDown, // [Analog]
1482 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickLeft, // [Analog]
1483 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickRight, // [Analog]
1484
1485 // Keyboard Modifiers (explicitly submitted by backend via AddKeyEvent() calls)
1486 // - This is mirroring the data also written to io.KeyCtrl, io.KeyShift, io.KeyAlt, io.KeySuper, in a format allowing
1487 // them to be accessed via standard key API, allowing calls such as IsKeyPressed(), IsKeyReleased(), querying duration etc.
1488 // - Code polling every keys (e.g. an interface to detect a key press for input mapping) might want to ignore those
1489 // and prefer using the real keys (e.g. ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl, ImGuiKey_RightCtrl instead of ImGuiKey_ModCtrl).
1490 // - In theory the value of keyboard modifiers should be roughly equivalent to a logical or of the equivalent left/right keys.
1491 // In practice: it's complicated; mods are often provided from different sources. Keyboard layout, IME, sticky keys and
1492 // backends tend to interfere and break that equivalence. The safer decision is to relay that ambiguity down to the end-user...
1493 ImGuiKey_ModCtrl, ImGuiKey_ModShift, ImGuiKey_ModAlt, ImGuiKey_ModSuper,
1494
1495 // End of list
1496 ImGuiKey_COUNT, // No valid ImGuiKey is ever greater than this value
1497
1498 // [Internal] Prior to 1.87 we required user to fill io.KeysDown[512] using their own native index + a io.KeyMap[] array.
1499 // We are ditching this method but keeping a legacy path for user code doing e.g. IsKeyPressed(MY_NATIVE_KEY_CODE)
1500 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN = 512,
1501 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END = ImGuiKey_COUNT,
1502 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN,
1503#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
1504 ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT, // Size of KeysData[]: only hold named keys
1505 ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN // First key stored in KeysData[0]
1506#else
1507 ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE = ImGuiKey_COUNT, // Size of KeysData[]: hold legacy 0..512 keycodes + named keys
1508 ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET = 0 // First key stored in KeysData[0]
1509#endif
1510
1511#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1512 , ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter = ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter // Renamed in 1.87
1513#endif
1514};
1515
1516// Helper "flags" version of key-mods to store and compare multiple key-mods easily. Sometimes used for storage (e.g. io.KeyMods) but otherwise not much used in public API.
1517enum ImGuiModFlags_
1518{
1519 ImGuiModFlags_None = 0,
1520 ImGuiModFlags_Ctrl = 1 << 0,
1521 ImGuiModFlags_Shift = 1 << 1,
1522 ImGuiModFlags_Alt = 1 << 2, // Menu
1523 ImGuiModFlags_Super = 1 << 3 // Cmd/Super/Windows key
1524};
1525
1526// Gamepad/Keyboard navigation
1527// Keyboard: Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard to enable. NewFrame() will automatically fill io.NavInputs[] based on your io.AddKeyEvent() calls.
1528// Gamepad: Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad to enable. Backend: set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad and fill the io.NavInputs[] fields before calling NewFrame(). Note that io.NavInputs[] is cleared by EndFrame().
1529// Read instructions in imgui.cpp for more details. Download PNG/PSD at http://dearimgui.org/controls_sheets.
1530enum ImGuiNavInput_
1531{
1532 // Gamepad Mapping
1533 ImGuiNavInput_Activate, // Activate / Open / Toggle / Tweak value // e.g. Cross (PS4), A (Xbox), A (Switch), Space (Keyboard)
1534 ImGuiNavInput_Cancel, // Cancel / Close / Exit // e.g. Circle (PS4), B (Xbox), B (Switch), Escape (Keyboard)
1535 ImGuiNavInput_Input, // Text input / On-Screen keyboard // e.g. Triang.(PS4), Y (Xbox), X (Switch), Return (Keyboard)
1536 ImGuiNavInput_Menu, // Tap: Toggle menu / Hold: Focus, Move, Resize // e.g. Square (PS4), X (Xbox), Y (Switch), Alt (Keyboard)
1537 ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, // Move / Tweak / Resize window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. D-pad Left/Right/Up/Down (Gamepads), Arrow keys (Keyboard)
1538 ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, //
1539 ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, //
1540 ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, //
1541 ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft, // Scroll / Move window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. Left Analog Stick Left/Right/Up/Down
1542 ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight, //
1543 ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp, //
1544 ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown, //
1545 ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, // Focus Next window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. L1 or L2 (PS4), LB or LT (Xbox), L or ZL (Switch)
1546 ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, // Focus Prev window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. R1 or R2 (PS4), RB or RT (Xbox), R or ZL (Switch)
1547 ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow, // Slower tweaks // e.g. L1 or L2 (PS4), LB or LT (Xbox), L or ZL (Switch)
1548 ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast, // Faster tweaks // e.g. R1 or R2 (PS4), RB or RT (Xbox), R or ZL (Switch)
1549
1550 // [Internal] Don't use directly! This is used internally to differentiate keyboard from gamepad inputs for behaviors that require to differentiate them.
1551 // Keyboard behavior that have no corresponding gamepad mapping (e.g. CTRL+TAB) will be directly reading from keyboard keys instead of io.NavInputs[].
1552 ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, // Move left // = Arrow keys
1553 ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, // Move right
1554 ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, // Move up
1555 ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, // Move down
1556 ImGuiNavInput_COUNT
1557};
1558
1559// Configuration flags stored in io.ConfigFlags. Set by user/application.
1560enum ImGuiConfigFlags_
1561{
1562 ImGuiConfigFlags_None = 0,
1563 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard = 1 << 0, // Master keyboard navigation enable flag. NewFrame() will automatically fill io.NavInputs[] based on io.AddKeyEvent() calls
1564 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad = 1 << 1, // Master gamepad navigation enable flag. This is mostly to instruct your imgui backend to fill io.NavInputs[]. Backend also needs to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.
1565 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // Instruct navigation to move the mouse cursor. May be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is awkward. Will update io.MousePos and set io.WantSetMousePos=true. If enabled you MUST honor io.WantSetMousePos requests in your backend, otherwise ImGui will react as if the mouse is jumping around back and forth.
1566 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard = 1 << 3, // Instruct navigation to not set the io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag when io.NavActive is set.
1567 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse = 1 << 4, // Instruct imgui to clear mouse position/buttons in NewFrame(). This allows ignoring the mouse information set by the backend.
1568 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange = 1 << 5, // Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility. Use if the backend cursor changes are interfering with yours and you don't want to use SetMouseCursor() to change mouse cursor. You may want to honor requests from imgui by reading GetMouseCursor() yourself instead.
1569
1570 // [BETA] Docking
1571 ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable = 1 << 6, // Docking enable flags.
1572
1573 // [BETA] Viewports
1574 // When using viewports it is recommended that your default value for ImGuiCol_WindowBg is opaque (Alpha=1.0) so transition to a viewport won't be noticeable.
1575 ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable = 1 << 10, // Viewport enable flags (require both ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports + ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports set by the respective backends)
1576 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports= 1 << 14, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Reposition and resize imgui windows when the DpiScale of a viewport changed (mostly useful for the main viewport hosting other window). Note that resizing the main window itself is up to your application.
1577 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts = 1 << 15, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Request bitmap-scaled fonts to match DpiScale. This is a very low-quality workaround. The correct way to handle DPI is _currently_ to replace the atlas and/or fonts in the Platform_OnChangedViewport callback, but this is all early work in progress.
1578
1579 // User storage (to allow your backend/engine to communicate to code that may be shared between multiple projects. Those flags are not used by core Dear ImGui)
1580 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsSRGB = 1 << 20, // Application is SRGB-aware.
1581 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen = 1 << 21 // Application is using a touch screen instead of a mouse.
1582};
1583
1584// Backend capabilities flags stored in io.BackendFlags. Set by imgui_impl_xxx or custom backend.
1585enum ImGuiBackendFlags_
1586{
1587 ImGuiBackendFlags_None = 0,
1588 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad = 1 << 0, // Backend Platform supports gamepad and currently has one connected.
1589 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors = 1 << 1, // Backend Platform supports honoring GetMouseCursor() value to change the OS cursor shape.
1590 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // Backend Platform supports io.WantSetMousePos requests to reposition the OS mouse position (only used if ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos is set).
1591 ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset = 1 << 3, // Backend Renderer supports ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset. This enables output of large meshes (64K+ vertices) while still using 16-bit indices.
1592
1593 // [BETA] Viewports
1594 ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports = 1 << 10, // Backend Platform supports multiple viewports.
1595 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport=1 << 11, // Backend Platform supports calling io.AddMouseViewportEvent() with the viewport under the mouse. IF POSSIBLE, ignore viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag (Win32 backend, GLFW 3.30+ backend can do this, SDL backend cannot). If this cannot be done, Dear ImGui needs to use a flawed heuristic to find the viewport under.
1596 ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports = 1 << 12 // Backend Renderer supports multiple viewports.
1597};
1598
1599// Enumeration for PushStyleColor() / PopStyleColor()
1600enum ImGuiCol_
1601{
1602 ImGuiCol_Text,
1603 ImGuiCol_TextDisabled,
1604 ImGuiCol_WindowBg, // Background of normal windows
1605 ImGuiCol_ChildBg, // Background of child windows
1606 ImGuiCol_PopupBg, // Background of popups, menus, tooltips windows
1607 ImGuiCol_Border,
1608 ImGuiCol_BorderShadow,
1609 ImGuiCol_FrameBg, // Background of checkbox, radio button, plot, slider, text input
1610 ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered,
1611 ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive,
1612 ImGuiCol_TitleBg,
1613 ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive,
1614 ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed,
1615 ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg,
1616 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarBg,
1617 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrab,
1618 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabHovered,
1619 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabActive,
1620 ImGuiCol_CheckMark,
1621 ImGuiCol_SliderGrab,
1622 ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive,
1623 ImGuiCol_Button,
1624 ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered,
1625 ImGuiCol_ButtonActive,
1626 ImGuiCol_Header, // Header* colors are used for CollapsingHeader, TreeNode, Selectable, MenuItem
1627 ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered,
1628 ImGuiCol_HeaderActive,
1629 ImGuiCol_Separator,
1630 ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered,
1631 ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive,
1632 ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip,
1633 ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered,
1634 ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive,
1635 ImGuiCol_Tab,
1636 ImGuiCol_TabHovered,
1637 ImGuiCol_TabActive,
1638 ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused,
1639 ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive,
1640 ImGuiCol_DockingPreview, // Preview overlay color when about to docking something
1641 ImGuiCol_DockingEmptyBg, // Background color for empty node (e.g. CentralNode with no window docked into it)
1642 ImGuiCol_PlotLines,
1643 ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered,
1644 ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram,
1645 ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered,
1646 ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg, // Table header background
1647 ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong, // Table outer and header borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
1648 ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight, // Table inner borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
1649 ImGuiCol_TableRowBg, // Table row background (even rows)
1650 ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt, // Table row background (odd rows)
1651 ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg,
1652 ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget,
1653 ImGuiCol_NavHighlight, // Gamepad/keyboard: current highlighted item
1654 ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, // Highlight window when using CTRL+TAB
1655 ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind the CTRL+TAB window list, when active
1656 ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind a modal window, when one is active
1657 ImGuiCol_COUNT
1658};
1659
1660// Enumeration for PushStyleVar() / PopStyleVar() to temporarily modify the ImGuiStyle structure.
1661// - The enum only refers to fields of ImGuiStyle which makes sense to be pushed/popped inside UI code.
1662// During initialization or between frames, feel free to just poke into ImGuiStyle directly.
1663// - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _second column_ below to find the actual members and their description.
1664// In Visual Studio IDE: CTRL+comma ("Edit.NavigateTo") can follow symbols in comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
1665// With Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols in comments.
1666// - When changing this enum, you need to update the associated internal table GStyleVarInfo[] accordingly. This is where we link enum values to members offset/type.
1667enum ImGuiStyleVar_
1668{
1669 // Enum name --------------------- // Member in ImGuiStyle structure (see ImGuiStyle for descriptions)
1670 ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, // float Alpha
1671 ImGuiStyleVar_DisabledAlpha, // float DisabledAlpha
1672 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, // ImVec2 WindowPadding
1673 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, // float WindowRounding
1674 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize, // float WindowBorderSize
1675 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize, // ImVec2 WindowMinSize
1676 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowTitleAlign, // ImVec2 WindowTitleAlign
1677 ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, // float ChildRounding
1678 ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, // float ChildBorderSize
1679 ImGuiStyleVar_PopupRounding, // float PopupRounding
1680 ImGuiStyleVar_PopupBorderSize, // float PopupBorderSize
1681 ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, // ImVec2 FramePadding
