2630 // If you want to create ImDrawList instances, pass them ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData() or create and use your own ImDrawListSharedData (so you can use ImDrawList without ImGui)
2631 ImDrawList(const ImDrawListSharedData* shared_data) { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); _Data = shared_data; }
2632
2633 ~ImDrawList() { _ClearFreeMemory(); }
2634 IMGUI_API void PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect = false); // Render-level scissoring. This is passed down to your render function but not used for CPU-side coarse clipping. Prefer using higher-level ImGui::PushClipRect() to affect logic (hit-testing and widget culling)
2635 IMGUI_API void PushClipRectFullScreen();
2636 IMGUI_API void PopClipRect();
2637 IMGUI_API void PushTextureID(ImTextureID texture_id);
2638 IMGUI_API void PopTextureID();
2639 inline ImVec2 GetClipRectMin() const { const ImVec4& cr = _ClipRectStack.back(); return ImVec2(cr.x, cr.y); }
2640 inline ImVec2 GetClipRectMax() const { const ImVec4& cr = _ClipRectStack.back(); return ImVec2(cr.z, cr.w); }
2641
2642 // Primitives
2643 // - Filled shapes must always use clockwise winding order. The anti-aliasing fringe depends on it. Counter-clockwise shapes will have "inward" anti-aliasing.
2644 // - For rectangular primitives, "p_min" and "p_max" represent the upper-left and lower-right corners.
2645 // - For circle primitives, use "num_segments == 0" to automatically calculate tessellation (preferred).
2646 // In older versions (until Dear ImGui 1.77) the AddCircle functions defaulted to num_segments == 12.
2647 // In future versions we will use textures to provide cheaper and higher-quality circles.
2648 // Use AddNgon() and AddNgonFilled() functions if you need to guaranteed a specific number of sides.
2649 IMGUI_API void AddLine(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
2650 IMGUI_API void AddRect(const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, ImU32 col, float rounding = 0.0f, ImDrawFlags flags = 0, float thickness = 1.0f); // a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size)
2651 IMGUI_API void AddRectFilled(const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, ImU32 col, float rounding = 0.0f, ImDrawFlags flags = 0); // a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size)
2652 IMGUI_API void AddRectFilledMultiColor(const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, ImU32 col_upr_left, ImU32 col_upr_right, ImU32 col_bot_right, ImU32 col_bot_left);
2653 IMGUI_API void AddQuad(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
2654 IMGUI_API void AddQuadFilled(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col);
2655 IMGUI_API void AddTriangle(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
2656 IMGUI_API void AddTriangleFilled(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, ImU32 col);
2657 IMGUI_API void AddCircle(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments = 0, float thickness = 1.0f);
2658 IMGUI_API void AddCircleFilled(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments = 0);
2659 IMGUI_API void AddNgon(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments, float thickness = 1.0f);
2660 IMGUI_API void AddNgonFilled(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments);
2661 IMGUI_API void AddText(const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL);
2662 IMGUI_API void AddText(const ImFont* font, float font_size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL, float wrap_width = 0.0f, const ImVec4* cpu_fine_clip_rect = NULL);
2663 IMGUI_API void AddPolyline(const ImVec2* points, int num_points, ImU32 col, ImDrawFlags flags, float thickness);
2664 IMGUI_API void AddConvexPolyFilled(const ImVec2* points, int num_points, ImU32 col);
2665 IMGUI_API void AddBezierCubic(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col, float thickness, int num_segments = 0); // Cubic Bezier (4 control points)
2666 IMGUI_API void AddBezierQuadratic(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, ImU32 col, float thickness, int num_segments = 0); // Quadratic Bezier (3 control points)
2667
2668 // Image primitives
2669 // - Read FAQ to understand what ImTextureID is.
2670 // - "p_min" and "p_max" represent the upper-left and lower-right corners of the rectangle.
2671 // - "uv_min" and "uv_max" represent the normalized texture coordinates to use for those corners. Using (0,0)->(1,1) texture coordinates will generally display the entire texture.
2672 IMGUI_API void AddImage(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, const ImVec2& uv_min = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2& uv_max = ImVec2(1, 1), ImU32 col = IM_COL32_WHITE);
2673 IMGUI_API void AddImageQuad(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, const ImVec2& uv1 = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2& uv2 = ImVec2(1, 0), const ImVec2& uv3 = ImVec2(1, 1), const ImVec2& uv4 = ImVec2(0, 1), ImU32 col = IM_COL32_WHITE);
2674 IMGUI_API void AddImageRounded(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, const ImVec2& uv_min, const ImVec2& uv_max, ImU32 col, float rounding, ImDrawFlags flags = 0);
2675
2676 // Stateful path API, add points then finish with PathFillConvex() or PathStroke()
2677 // - Filled shapes must always use clockwise winding order. The anti-aliasing fringe depends on it. Counter-clockwise shapes will have "inward" anti-aliasing.
2678 inline void PathClear() { _Path.Size = 0; }
2679 inline void PathLineTo(const ImVec2& pos) { _Path.push_back(pos); }
2680 inline void PathLineToMergeDuplicate(const ImVec2& pos) { if (_Path.Size == 0 || memcmp(&_Path.Data[_Path.Size - 1], &pos, 8) != 0) _Path.push_back(pos); }
2681 inline void PathFillConvex(ImU32 col) { AddConvexPolyFilled(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col); _Path.Size = 0; }
2682 inline void PathStroke(ImU32 col, ImDrawFlags flags = 0, float thickness = 1.0f) { AddPolyline(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col, flags, thickness); _Path.Size = 0; }
2683 IMGUI_API void PathArcTo(const ImVec2& center, float radius, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments = 0);
2684 IMGUI_API void PathArcToFast(const ImVec2& center, float radius, int a_min_of_12, int a_max_of_12); // Use precomputed angles for a 12 steps circle
2685 IMGUI_API void PathBezierCubicCurveTo(const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, int num_segments = 0); // Cubic Bezier (4 control points)
2686 IMGUI_API void PathBezierQuadraticCurveTo(const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, int num_segments = 0); // Quadratic Bezier (3 control points)
2687 IMGUI_API void PathRect(const ImVec2& rect_min, const ImVec2& rect_max, float rounding = 0.0f, ImDrawFlags flags = 0);
2688
2689 // Advanced
2690 IMGUI_API void AddCallback(ImDrawCallback callback, void* callback_data); // Your rendering function must check for 'UserCallback' in ImDrawCmd and call the function instead of rendering triangles.
2691 IMGUI_API void AddDrawCmd(); // This is useful if you need to forcefully create a new draw call (to allow for dependent rendering / blending). Otherwise primitives are merged into the same draw-call as much as possible
2692 IMGUI_API ImDrawList* CloneOutput() const; // Create a clone of the CmdBuffer/IdxBuffer/VtxBuffer.
2693
2694 // Advanced: Channels
2695 // - Use to split render into layers. By switching channels to can render out-of-order (e.g. submit FG primitives before BG primitives)
2696 // - Use to minimize draw calls (e.g. if going back-and-forth between multiple clipping rectangles, prefer to append into separate channels then merge at the end)
2697 // - FIXME-OBSOLETE: This API shouldn't have been in ImDrawList in the first place!
2698 // Prefer using your own persistent instance of ImDrawListSplitter as you can stack them.
2699 // Using the ImDrawList::ChannelsXXXX you cannot stack a split over another.
2700 inline void ChannelsSplit(int count) { _Splitter.Split(this, count); }
2701 inline void ChannelsMerge() { _Splitter.Merge(this); }
2702 inline void ChannelsSetCurrent(int n) { _Splitter.SetCurrentChannel(this, n); }
2703
2704 // Advanced: Primitives allocations
2705 // - We render triangles (three vertices)
2706 // - All primitives needs to be reserved via PrimReserve() beforehand.
2707 IMGUI_API void PrimReserve(int idx_count, int vtx_count);
2708 IMGUI_API void PrimUnreserve(int idx_count, int vtx_count);
2709 IMGUI_API void PrimRect(const ImVec2& a, const ImVec2& b, ImU32 col); // Axis aligned rectangle (composed of two triangles)
2710 IMGUI_API void PrimRectUV(const ImVec2& a, const ImVec2& b, const ImVec2& uv_a, const ImVec2& uv_b, ImU32 col);
2711 IMGUI_API void PrimQuadUV(const ImVec2& a, const ImVec2& b, const ImVec2& c, const ImVec2& d, const ImVec2& uv_a, const ImVec2& uv_b, const ImVec2& uv_c, const ImVec2& uv_d, ImU32 col);
2712 inline void PrimWriteVtx(const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& uv, ImU32 col) { _VtxWritePtr->pos = pos; _VtxWritePtr->uv = uv; _VtxWritePtr->col = col; _VtxWritePtr++; _VtxCurrentIdx++; }
2713 inline void PrimWriteIdx(ImDrawIdx idx) { *_IdxWritePtr = idx; _IdxWritePtr++; }
2714 inline void PrimVtx(const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& uv, ImU32 col) { PrimWriteIdx((ImDrawIdx)_VtxCurrentIdx); PrimWriteVtx(pos, uv, col); } // Write vertex with unique index
2715
2716#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2717 inline void AddBezierCurve(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col, float thickness, int num_segments = 0) { AddBezierCubic(p1, p2, p3, p4, col, thickness, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.80 (Jan 2021)
2718 inline void PathBezierCurveTo(const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, int num_segments = 0) { PathBezierCubicCurveTo(p2, p3, p4, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.80 (Jan 2021)
2719#endif
2720
2721 // [Internal helpers]
2722 IMGUI_API void _ResetForNewFrame();
2723 IMGUI_API void _ClearFreeMemory();
2724 IMGUI_API void _PopUnusedDrawCmd();
2725 IMGUI_API void _TryMergeDrawCmds();
2726 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedClipRect();
2727 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedTextureID();
2728 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedVtxOffset();
2729 IMGUI_API int _CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(float radius) const;
2730 IMGUI_API void _PathArcToFastEx(const ImVec2& center, float radius, int a_min_sample, int a_max_sample, int a_step);
2731 IMGUI_API void _PathArcToN(const ImVec2& center, float radius, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments);
2732};
2733
2734// All draw data to render a Dear ImGui frame
2735// (NB: the style and the naming convention here is a little inconsistent, we currently preserve them for backward compatibility purpose,
2736// as this is one of the oldest structure exposed by the library! Basically, ImDrawList == CmdList)
2737struct ImDrawData
2738{
2739 bool Valid; // Only valid after Render() is called and before the next NewFrame() is called.
2740 int CmdListsCount; // Number of ImDrawList* to render
2741 int TotalIdxCount; // For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's IdxBuffer.Size
2742 int TotalVtxCount; // For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's VtxBuffer.Size
2743 ImDrawList** CmdLists; // Array of ImDrawList* to render. The ImDrawList are owned by ImGuiContext and only pointed to from here.
2744 ImVec2 DisplayPos; // Top-left position of the viewport to render (== top-left of the orthogonal projection matrix to use) (== GetMainViewport()->Pos for the main viewport, == (0.0) in most single-viewport applications)
2745 ImVec2 DisplaySize; // Size of the viewport to render (== GetMainViewport()->Size for the main viewport, == io.DisplaySize in most single-viewport applications)
2746 ImVec2 FramebufferScale; // Amount of pixels for each unit of DisplaySize. Based on io.DisplayFramebufferScale. Generally (1,1) on normal display, (2,2) on OSX with Retina display.
2747 ImGuiViewport* OwnerViewport; // Viewport carrying the ImDrawData instance, might be of use to the renderer (generally not).
2748
2749 // Functions
2750 ImDrawData() { Clear(); }
2751 void Clear() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); } // The ImDrawList are owned by ImGuiContext!
2752 IMGUI_API void DeIndexAllBuffers(); // Helper to convert all buffers from indexed to non-indexed, in case you cannot render indexed. Note: this is slow and most likely a waste of resources. Always prefer indexed rendering!
2753 IMGUI_API void ScaleClipRects(const ImVec2& fb_scale); // Helper to scale the ClipRect field of each ImDrawCmd. Use if your final output buffer is at a different scale than Dear ImGui expects, or if there is a difference between your window resolution and framebuffer resolution.
2754};
2755
2756//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2757// [SECTION] Font API (ImFontConfig, ImFontGlyph, ImFontAtlasFlags, ImFontAtlas, ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder, ImFont)
2758//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2759
2760struct ImFontConfig
2761{
2762 void* FontData; // // TTF/OTF data
2763 int FontDataSize; // // TTF/OTF data size
2764 bool FontDataOwnedByAtlas; // true // TTF/OTF data ownership taken by the container ImFontAtlas (will delete memory itself).
2765 int FontNo; // 0 // Index of font within TTF/OTF file
2766 float SizePixels; // // Size in pixels for rasterizer (more or less maps to the resulting font height).
2767 int OversampleH; // 3 // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. Note the difference between 2 and 3 is minimal so you can reduce this to 2 to save memory. Read https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/tests/oversample/README.md for details.
2768 int OversampleV; // 1 // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. This is not really useful as we don't use sub-pixel positions on the Y axis.
2769 bool PixelSnapH; // false // Align every glyph to pixel boundary. Useful e.g. if you are merging a non-pixel aligned font with the default font. If enabled, you can set OversampleH/V to 1.
2770 ImVec2 GlyphExtraSpacing; // 0, 0 // Extra spacing (in pixels) between glyphs. Only X axis is supported for now.
2771 ImVec2 GlyphOffset; // 0, 0 // Offset all glyphs from this font input.
2772 const ImWchar* GlyphRanges; // NULL // Pointer to a user-provided list of Unicode range (2 value per range, values are inclusive, zero-terminated list). THE ARRAY DATA NEEDS TO PERSIST AS LONG AS THE FONT IS ALIVE.
2773 float GlyphMinAdvanceX; // 0 // Minimum AdvanceX for glyphs, set Min to align font icons, set both Min/Max to enforce mono-space font
2774 float GlyphMaxAdvanceX; // FLT_MAX // Maximum AdvanceX for glyphs
2775 bool MergeMode; // false // Merge into previous ImFont, so you can combine multiple inputs font into one ImFont (e.g. ASCII font + icons + Japanese glyphs). You may want to use GlyphOffset.y when merge font of different heights.
2776 unsigned int FontBuilderFlags; // 0 // Settings for custom font builder. THIS IS BUILDER IMPLEMENTATION DEPENDENT. Leave as zero if unsure.
2777 float RasterizerMultiply; // 1.0f // Brighten (>1.0f) or darken (<1.0f) font output. Brightening small fonts may be a good workaround to make them more readable.
2778 ImWchar EllipsisChar; // -1 // Explicitly specify unicode codepoint of ellipsis character. When fonts are being merged first specified ellipsis will be used.
2779
2780 // [Internal]
2781 char Name[40]; // Name (strictly to ease debugging)
2782 ImFont* DstFont;
2783
2784 IMGUI_API ImFontConfig();
2785};
2786
2787// Hold rendering data for one glyph.
2788// (Note: some language parsers may fail to convert the 31+1 bitfield members, in this case maybe drop store a single u32 or we can rework this)
2789struct ImFontGlyph
2790{
2791 unsigned int Colored : 1; // Flag to indicate glyph is colored and should generally ignore tinting (make it usable with no shift on little-endian as this is used in loops)
2792 unsigned int Visible : 1; // Flag to indicate glyph has no visible pixels (e.g. space). Allow early out when rendering.
2793 unsigned int Codepoint : 30; // 0x0000..0x10FFFF
2794 float AdvanceX; // Distance to next character (= data from font + ImFontConfig::GlyphExtraSpacing.x baked in)
2795 float X0, Y0, X1, Y1; // Glyph corners
2796 float U0, V0, U1, V1; // Texture coordinates
2797};
2798
2799// Helper to build glyph ranges from text/string data. Feed your application strings/characters to it then call BuildRanges().
2800// This is essentially a tightly packed of vector of 64k booleans = 8KB storage.
2801struct ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder
2802{
2803 ImVector<ImU32> UsedChars; // Store 1-bit per Unicode code point (0=unused, 1=used)
2804
2805 ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder() { Clear(); }
2806 inline void Clear() { int size_in_bytes = (IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX + 1) / 8; UsedChars.resize(size_in_bytes / (int)sizeof(ImU32)); memset(UsedChars.Data, 0, (size_t)size_in_bytes); }
2807 inline bool GetBit(size_t n) const { int off = (int)(n >> 5); ImU32 mask = 1u << (n & 31); return (UsedChars[off] & mask) != 0; } // Get bit n in the array
2808 inline void SetBit(size_t n) { int off = (int)(n >> 5); ImU32 mask = 1u << (n & 31); UsedChars[off] |= mask; } // Set bit n in the array
2809 inline void AddChar(ImWchar c) { SetBit(c); } // Add character
2810 IMGUI_API void AddText(const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL); // Add string (each character of the UTF-8 string are added)
2811 IMGUI_API void AddRanges(const ImWchar* ranges); // Add ranges, e.g. builder.AddRanges(ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesDefault()) to force add all of ASCII/Latin+Ext
2812 IMGUI_API void BuildRanges(ImVector<ImWchar>* out_ranges); // Output new ranges
2813};
2814
2815// See ImFontAtlas::AddCustomRectXXX functions.
2816struct ImFontAtlasCustomRect
2817{
2818 unsigned short Width, Height; // Input // Desired rectangle dimension
2819 unsigned short X, Y; // Output // Packed position in Atlas
2820 unsigned int GlyphID; // Input // For custom font glyphs only (ID < 0x110000)
2821 float GlyphAdvanceX; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph xadvance
2822 ImVec2 GlyphOffset; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph display offset
2823 ImFont* Font; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: target font
2824 ImFontAtlasCustomRect() { Width = Height = 0; X = Y = 0xFFFF; GlyphID = 0; GlyphAdvanceX = 0.0f; GlyphOffset = ImVec2(0, 0); Font = NULL; }
2825 bool IsPacked() const { return X != 0xFFFF; }
2826};
2827
2828// Flags for ImFontAtlas build
2829enum ImFontAtlasFlags_
2830{
2831 ImFontAtlasFlags_None = 0,
2832 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight = 1 << 0, // Don't round the height to next power of two
2833 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors = 1 << 1, // Don't build software mouse cursors into the atlas (save a little texture memory)
2834 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines = 1 << 2 // Don't build thick line textures into the atlas (save a little texture memory). The AntiAliasedLinesUseTex features uses them, otherwise they will be rendered using polygons (more expensive for CPU/GPU).
2835};
2836
2837// Load and rasterize multiple TTF/OTF fonts into a same texture. The font atlas will build a single texture holding:
2838// - One or more fonts.
2839// - Custom graphics data needed to render the shapes needed by Dear ImGui.
2840// - Mouse cursor shapes for software cursor rendering (unless setting 'Flags |= ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors' in the font atlas).
2841// It is the user-code responsibility to setup/build the atlas, then upload the pixel data into a texture accessible by your graphics api.
2842// - Optionally, call any of the AddFont*** functions. If you don't call any, the default font embedded in the code will be loaded for you.
2843// - Call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32() to build and retrieve pixels data.
2844// - Upload the pixels data into a texture within your graphics system (see imgui_impl_xxxx.cpp examples)
2845// - Call SetTexID(my_tex_id); and pass the pointer/identifier to your texture in a format natural to your graphics API.
2846// This value will be passed back to you during rendering to identify the texture. Read FAQ entry about ImTextureID for more details.
2847// Common pitfalls:
2848// - If you pass a 'glyph_ranges' array to AddFont*** functions, you need to make sure that your array persist up until the
2849// atlas is build (when calling GetTexData*** or Build()). We only copy the pointer, not the data.
2850// - Important: By default, AddFontFromMemoryTTF() takes ownership of the data. Even though we are not writing to it, we will free the pointer on destruction.
2851// You can set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed,
2852// - Even though many functions are suffixed with "TTF", OTF data is supported just as well.
2853// - This is an old API and it is currently awkward for those and and various other reasons! We will address them in the future!
2854struct ImFontAtlas
2855{
2856 IMGUI_API ImFontAtlas();
2857 IMGUI_API ~ImFontAtlas();
2858 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFont(const ImFontConfig* font_cfg);
2859 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontDefault(const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL);
2860 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromFileTTF(const char* filename, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL);
2861 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryTTF(void* font_data, int font_size, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // Note: Transfer ownership of 'ttf_data' to ImFontAtlas! Will be deleted after destruction of the atlas. Set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed.
2862 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryCompressedTTF(const void* compressed_font_data, int compressed_font_size, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // 'compressed_font_data' still owned by caller. Compress with binary_to_compressed_c.cpp.
2863 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryCompressedBase85TTF(const char* compressed_font_data_base85, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // 'compressed_font_data_base85' still owned by caller. Compress with binary_to_compressed_c.cpp with -base85 parameter.
2864 IMGUI_API void ClearInputData(); // Clear input data (all ImFontConfig structures including sizes, TTF data, glyph ranges, etc.) = all the data used to build the texture and fonts.
2865 IMGUI_API void ClearTexData(); // Clear output texture data (CPU side). Saves RAM once the texture has been copied to graphics memory.
2866 IMGUI_API void ClearFonts(); // Clear output font data (glyphs storage, UV coordinates).
2867 IMGUI_API void Clear(); // Clear all input and output.
2868
2869 // Build atlas, retrieve pixel data.
2870 // User is in charge of copying the pixels into graphics memory (e.g. create a texture with your engine). Then store your texture handle with SetTexID().
2871 // The pitch is always = Width * BytesPerPixels (1 or 4)
2872 // Building in RGBA32 format is provided for convenience and compatibility, but note that unless you manually manipulate or copy color data into
2873 // the texture (e.g. when using the AddCustomRect*** api), then the RGB pixels emitted will always be white (~75% of memory/bandwidth waste.
2874 IMGUI_API bool Build(); // Build pixels data. This is called automatically for you by the GetTexData*** functions.
2875 IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsAlpha8(unsigned char** out_pixels, int* out_width, int* out_height, int* out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 1 byte per-pixel
2876 IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsRGBA32(unsigned char** out_pixels, int* out_width, int* out_height, int* out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 4 bytes-per-pixel
2877 bool IsBuilt() const { return Fonts.Size > 0 && TexReady; } // Bit ambiguous: used to detect when user didn't built texture but effectively we should check TexID != 0 except that would be backend dependent...
2878 void SetTexID(ImTextureID id) { TexID = id; }
2879
2880 //-------------------------------------------
2881 // Glyph Ranges
2882 //-------------------------------------------
2883
2884 // Helpers to retrieve list of common Unicode ranges (2 value per range, values are inclusive, zero-terminated list)
2885 // NB: Make sure that your string are UTF-8 and NOT in your local code page. In C++11, you can create UTF-8 string literal using the u8"Hello world" syntax. See FAQ for details.
2886 // NB: Consider using ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder to build glyph ranges from textual data.
2887 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesDefault(); // Basic Latin, Extended Latin
2888 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesKorean(); // Default + Korean characters
2889 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesJapanese(); // Default + Hiragana, Katakana, Half-Width, Selection of 2999 Ideographs
2890 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesChineseFull(); // Default + Half-Width + Japanese Hiragana/Katakana + full set of about 21000 CJK Unified Ideographs
2891 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesChineseSimplifiedCommon();// Default + Half-Width + Japanese Hiragana/Katakana + set of 2500 CJK Unified Ideographs for common simplified Chinese
2892 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesCyrillic(); // Default + about 400 Cyrillic characters
2893 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesThai(); // Default + Thai characters
2894 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesVietnamese(); // Default + Vietnamese characters
2895
2896 //-------------------------------------------
2897 // [BETA] Custom Rectangles/Glyphs API
2898 //-------------------------------------------
2899
2900 // You can request arbitrary rectangles to be packed into the atlas, for your own purposes.
2901 // - After calling Build(), you can query the rectangle position and render your pixels.
2902 // - If you render colored output, set 'atlas->TexPixelsUseColors = true' as this may help some backends decide of prefered texture format.
2903 // - You can also request your rectangles to be mapped as font glyph (given a font + Unicode point),
2904 // so you can render e.g. custom colorful icons and use them as regular glyphs.
2905 // - Read docs/FONTS.md for more details about using colorful icons.
2906 // - Note: this API may be redesigned later in order to support multi-monitor varying DPI settings.
2907 IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectRegular(int width, int height);
2908 IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectFontGlyph(ImFont* font, ImWchar id, int width, int height, float advance_x, const ImVec2& offset = ImVec2(0, 0));
2909 ImFontAtlasCustomRect* GetCustomRectByIndex(int index) { IM_ASSERT(index >= 0); return &CustomRects[index]; }
2910
2911 // [Internal]
2912 IMGUI_API void CalcCustomRectUV(const ImFontAtlasCustomRect* rect, ImVec2* out_uv_min, ImVec2* out_uv_max) const;
2913 IMGUI_API bool GetMouseCursorTexData(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor, ImVec2* out_offset, ImVec2* out_size, ImVec2 out_uv_border[2], ImVec2 out_uv_fill[2]);
2914
2915 //-------------------------------------------
2916 // Members
2917 //-------------------------------------------
2918
2919 ImFontAtlasFlags Flags; // Build flags (see ImFontAtlasFlags_)
2920 ImTextureID TexID; // User data to refer to the texture once it has been uploaded to user's graphic systems. It is passed back to you during rendering via the ImDrawCmd structure.
2921 int TexDesiredWidth; // Texture width desired by user before Build(). Must be a power-of-two. If have many glyphs your graphics API have texture size restrictions you may want to increase texture width to decrease height.
2922 int TexGlyphPadding; // Padding between glyphs within texture in pixels. Defaults to 1. If your rendering method doesn't rely on bilinear filtering you may set this to 0.
2923 bool Locked; // Marked as Locked by ImGui::NewFrame() so attempt to modify the atlas will assert.
2924
2925 // [Internal]
2926 // NB: Access texture data via GetTexData*() calls! Which will setup a default font for you.
2927 bool TexReady; // Set when texture was built matching current font input
2928 bool TexPixelsUseColors; // Tell whether our texture data is known to use colors (rather than just alpha channel), in order to help backend select a format.
2929 unsigned char* TexPixelsAlpha8; // 1 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth * TexHeight
2930 unsigned int* TexPixelsRGBA32; // 4 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth * TexHeight * 4
2931 int TexWidth; // Texture width calculated during Build().
2932 int TexHeight; // Texture height calculated during Build().
2933 ImVec2 TexUvScale; // = (1.0f/TexWidth, 1.0f/TexHeight)
2934 ImVec2 TexUvWhitePixel; // Texture coordinates to a white pixel
2935 ImVector<ImFont*> Fonts; // Hold all the fonts returned by AddFont*. Fonts[0] is the default font upon calling ImGui::NewFrame(), use ImGui::PushFont()/PopFont() to change the current font.
2936 ImVector<ImFontAtlasCustomRect> CustomRects; // Rectangles for packing custom texture data into the atlas.
2937 ImVector<ImFontConfig> ConfigData; // Configuration data
2938 ImVec4 TexUvLines[IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX + 1]; // UVs for baked anti-aliased lines
2939
2940 // [Internal] Font builder
2941 const ImFontBuilderIO* FontBuilderIO; // Opaque interface to a font builder (default to stb_truetype, can be changed to use FreeType by defining IMGUI_ENABLE_FREETYPE).
2942 unsigned int FontBuilderFlags; // Shared flags (for all fonts) for custom font builder. THIS IS BUILD IMPLEMENTATION DEPENDENT. Per-font override is also available in ImFontConfig.
2943
2944 // [Internal] Packing data
2945 int PackIdMouseCursors; // Custom texture rectangle ID for white pixel and mouse cursors
2946 int PackIdLines; // Custom texture rectangle ID for baked anti-aliased lines
2947
2948 // [Obsolete]
2949 //typedef ImFontAtlasCustomRect CustomRect; // OBSOLETED in 1.72+
2950 //typedef ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder GlyphRangesBuilder; // OBSOLETED in 1.67+
2951};
2952
2953// Font runtime data and rendering
2954// ImFontAtlas automatically loads a default embedded font for you when you call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32().
2955struct ImFont
2956{
2957 // Members: Hot ~20/24 bytes (for CalcTextSize)
2958 ImVector<float> IndexAdvanceX; // 12-16 // out // // Sparse. Glyphs->AdvanceX in a directly indexable way (cache-friendly for CalcTextSize functions which only this this info, and are often bottleneck in large UI).
2959 float FallbackAdvanceX; // 4 // out // = FallbackGlyph->AdvanceX
2960 float FontSize; // 4 // in // // Height of characters/line, set during loading (don't change after loading)
2961
2962 // Members: Hot ~28/40 bytes (for CalcTextSize + render loop)
2963 ImVector<ImWchar> IndexLookup; // 12-16 // out // // Sparse. Index glyphs by Unicode code-point.
2964 ImVector<ImFontGlyph> Glyphs; // 12-16 // out // // All glyphs.
2965 const ImFontGlyph* FallbackGlyph; // 4-8 // out // = FindGlyph(FontFallbackChar)
2966
2967 // Members: Cold ~32/40 bytes
2968 ImFontAtlas* ContainerAtlas; // 4-8 // out // // What we has been loaded into
2969 const ImFontConfig* ConfigData; // 4-8 // in // // Pointer within ContainerAtlas->ConfigData
2970 short ConfigDataCount; // 2 // in // ~ 1 // Number of ImFontConfig involved in creating this font. Bigger than 1 when merging multiple font sources into one ImFont.
2971 ImWchar FallbackChar; // 2 // out // = FFFD/'?' // Character used if a glyph isn't found.
2972 ImWchar EllipsisChar; // 2 // out // = '...' // Character used for ellipsis rendering.
2973 ImWchar DotChar; // 2 // out // = '.' // Character used for ellipsis rendering (if a single '...' character isn't found)
2974 bool DirtyLookupTables; // 1 // out //
2975 float Scale; // 4 // in // = 1.f // Base font scale, multiplied by the per-window font scale which you can adjust with SetWindowFontScale()
2976 float Ascent, Descent; // 4+4 // out // // Ascent: distance from top to bottom of e.g. 'A' [0..FontSize]
2977 int MetricsTotalSurface;// 4 // out // // Total surface in pixels to get an idea of the font rasterization/texture cost (not exact, we approximate the cost of padding between glyphs)
2978 ImU8 Used4kPagesMap[(IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX+1)/4096/8]; // 2 bytes if ImWchar=ImWchar16, 34 bytes if ImWchar==ImWchar32. Store 1-bit for each block of 4K codepoints that has one active glyph. This is mainly used to facilitate iterations across all used codepoints.
2979
2980 // Methods
2981 IMGUI_API ImFont();
2982 IMGUI_API ~ImFont();
2983 IMGUI_API const ImFontGlyph*FindGlyph(ImWchar c) const;
2984 IMGUI_API const ImFontGlyph*FindGlyphNoFallback(ImWchar c) const;
2985 float GetCharAdvance(ImWchar c) const { return ((int)c < IndexAdvanceX.Size) ? IndexAdvanceX[(int)c] : FallbackAdvanceX; }
2986 bool IsLoaded() const { return ContainerAtlas != NULL; }
2987 const char* GetDebugName() const { return ConfigData ? ConfigData->Name : "<unknown>"; }
2988
2989 // 'max_width' stops rendering after a certain width (could be turned into a 2d size). FLT_MAX to disable.
2990 // 'wrap_width' enable automatic word-wrapping across multiple lines to fit into given width. 0.0f to disable.
2991 IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSizeA(float size, float max_width, float wrap_width, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL, const char** remaining = NULL) const; // utf8
2992 IMGUI_API const char* CalcWordWrapPositionA(float scale, const char* text, const char* text_end, float wrap_width) const;
2993 IMGUI_API void RenderChar(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, ImWchar c) const;
2994 IMGUI_API void RenderText(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, const ImVec4& clip_rect, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end, float wrap_width = 0.0f, bool cpu_fine_clip = false) const;
2995
2996 // [Internal] Don't use!
2997 IMGUI_API void BuildLookupTable();
2998 IMGUI_API void ClearOutputData();
2999 IMGUI_API void GrowIndex(int new_size);
3000 IMGUI_API void AddGlyph(const ImFontConfig* src_cfg, ImWchar c, float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float u0, float v0, float u1, float v1, float advance_x);
3001 IMGUI_API void AddRemapChar(ImWchar dst, ImWchar src, bool overwrite_dst = true); // Makes 'dst' character/glyph points to 'src' character/glyph. Currently needs to be called AFTER fonts have been built.
3002 IMGUI_API void SetGlyphVisible(ImWchar c, bool visible);
3003 IMGUI_API bool IsGlyphRangeUnused(unsigned int c_begin, unsigned int c_last);
3004};
3005
3006//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3007// [SECTION] Viewports
3008//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3009
3010// Flags stored in ImGuiViewport::Flags, giving indications to the platform backends.
3011enum ImGuiViewportFlags_
3012{
3013 ImGuiViewportFlags_None = 0,
3014 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow = 1 << 0, // Represent a Platform Window
3015 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformMonitor = 1 << 1, // Represent a Platform Monitor (unused yet)
3016 ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp = 1 << 2, // Platform Window: is created/managed by the application (rather than a dear imgui backend)
3017 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration = 1 << 3, // Platform Window: Disable platform decorations: title bar, borders, etc. (generally set all windows, but if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsDecoration is set we only set this on popups/tooltips)
3018 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon = 1 << 4, // Platform Window: Disable platform task bar icon (generally set on popups/tooltips, or all windows if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsNoTaskBarIcon is set)
3019 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing = 1 << 5, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when created.
3020 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnClick = 1 << 6, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when clicked on.
3021 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs = 1 << 7, // Platform Window: Make mouse pass through so we can drag this window while peaking behind it.
3022 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear = 1 << 8, // Platform Window: Renderer doesn't need to clear the framebuffer ahead (because we will fill it entirely).
3023 ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost = 1 << 9, // Platform Window: Display on top (for tooltips only).
3024 ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized = 1 << 10, // Platform Window: Window is minimized, can skip render. When minimized we tend to avoid using the viewport pos/size for clipping window or testing if they are contained in the viewport.
3025 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge = 1 << 11, // Platform Window: Avoid merging this window into another host window. This can only be set via ImGuiWindowClass viewport flags override (because we need to now ahead if we are going to create a viewport in the first place!).
3026 ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows = 1 << 12 // Main viewport: can host multiple imgui windows (secondary viewports are associated to a single window).
3027};
3028
3029// - Currently represents the Platform Window created by the application which is hosting our Dear ImGui windows.
3030// - With multi-viewport enabled, we extend this concept to have multiple active viewports.
3031// - In the future we will extend this concept further to also represent Platform Monitor and support a "no main platform window" operation mode.
3032// - About Main Area vs Work Area:
3033// - Main Area = entire viewport.
3034// - Work Area = entire viewport minus sections used by main menu bars (for platform windows), or by task bar (for platform monitor).
3035// - Windows are generally trying to stay within the Work Area of their host viewport.
3036struct ImGuiViewport
3037{
3038 ImGuiID ID; // Unique identifier for the viewport
3039 ImGuiViewportFlags Flags; // See ImGuiViewportFlags_
3040 ImVec2 Pos; // Main Area: Position of the viewport (Dear ImGui coordinates are the same as OS desktop/native coordinates)
3041 ImVec2 Size; // Main Area: Size of the viewport.
3042 ImVec2 WorkPos; // Work Area: Position of the viewport minus task bars, menus bars, status bars (>= Pos)
3043 ImVec2 WorkSize; // Work Area: Size of the viewport minus task bars, menu bars, status bars (<= Size)
3044 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI = No extra scale.
3045 ImGuiID ParentViewportId; // (Advanced) 0: no parent. Instruct the platform backend to setup a parent/child relationship between platform windows.
3046 ImDrawData* DrawData; // The ImDrawData corresponding to this viewport. Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame().
3047
3048 // Platform/Backend Dependent Data
3049 // Our design separate the Renderer and Platform backends to facilitate combining default backends with each others.
3050 // When our create your own backend for a custom engine, it is possible that both Renderer and Platform will be handled
3051 // by the same system and you may not need to use all the UserData/Handle fields.
3052 // The library never uses those fields, they are merely storage to facilitate backend implementation.
3053 void* RendererUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the renderer (e.g. swap chain, framebuffers etc.). generally set by your Renderer_CreateWindow function.
3054 void* PlatformUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the OS / platform (e.g. windowing info, render context). generally set by your Platform_CreateWindow function.
3055 void* PlatformHandle; // void* for FindViewportByPlatformHandle(). (e.g. suggested to use natural platform handle such as HWND, GLFWWindow*, SDL_Window*)
3056 void* PlatformHandleRaw; // void* to hold lower-level, platform-native window handle (under Win32 this is expected to be a HWND, unused for other platforms), when using an abstraction layer like GLFW or SDL (where PlatformHandle would be a SDL_Window*)
3057 bool PlatformRequestMove; // Platform window requested move (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, authoritative position will be OS window position)
3058 bool PlatformRequestResize; // Platform window requested resize (e.g. window was resized by the OS / host window manager, authoritative size will be OS window size)
3059 bool PlatformRequestClose; // Platform window requested closure (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, e.g. pressing ALT-F4)
3060
3061 ImGuiViewport() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
3062 ~ImGuiViewport() { IM_ASSERT(PlatformUserData == NULL && RendererUserData == NULL); }
3063
3064 // Helpers
3065 ImVec2 GetCenter() const { return ImVec2(Pos.x + Size.x * 0.5f, Pos.y + Size.y * 0.5f); }
3066 ImVec2 GetWorkCenter() const { return ImVec2(WorkPos.x + WorkSize.x * 0.5f, WorkPos.y + WorkSize.y * 0.5f); }
3067};
3068
3069//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3070// [SECTION] Platform Dependent Interfaces (for e.g. multi-viewport support)
3071//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3072// [BETA] (Optional) This is completely optional, for advanced users!
3073// If you are new to Dear ImGui and trying to integrate it into your engine, you can probably ignore this for now.
3074//
3075// This feature allows you to seamlessly drag Dear ImGui windows outside of your application viewport.
3076// This is achieved by creating new Platform/OS windows on the fly, and rendering into them.
3077// Dear ImGui manages the viewport structures, and the backend create and maintain one Platform/OS window for each of those viewports.
3078//
3079// See Glossary https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary for details about some of the terminology.
3080// See Thread https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/1542 for gifs, news and questions about this evolving feature.
3081//
3082// About the coordinates system:
3083// - When multi-viewports are enabled, all Dear ImGui coordinates become absolute coordinates (same as OS coordinates!)
3084// - So e.g. ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(0,0)) will position a window relative to your primary monitor!
3085// - If you want to position windows relative to your main application viewport, use ImGui::GetMainViewport()->Pos as a base position.
3086//
3087// Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a default backend from the examples/ folder:
3088// - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'.
3089// - Backend: The backend initialization will setup all necessary ImGuiPlatformIO's functions and update monitors info every frame.
3090// - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after EndFrame() or Render().
3091// - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls.
3092//
3093// Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a custom backend:
3094// - Important: THIS IS NOT EASY TO DO and comes with many subtleties not described here!
3095// It's also an experimental feature, so some of the requirements may evolve.
3096// Consider using default backends if you can. Either way, carefully follow and refer to examples/ backends for details.
3097// - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'.
3098// - Backend: Hook ImGuiPlatformIO's Platform_* and Renderer_* callbacks (see below).
3099// Set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports' and 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports'.
3100// Update ImGuiPlatformIO's Monitors list every frame.
3101// Update MousePos every frame, in absolute coordinates.
3102// - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after EndFrame() or Render().
3103// You may skip calling RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() if its API is not convenient for your needs. Read comments below.
3104// - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls.
3105//
3106// About ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault():
3107// - This function is a mostly a _helper_ for the common-most cases, and to facilitate using default backends.
3108// - You can check its simple source code to understand what it does.
3109// It basically iterates secondary viewports and call 4 functions that are setup in ImGuiPlatformIO, if available:
3110// Platform_RenderWindow(), Renderer_RenderWindow(), Platform_SwapBuffers(), Renderer_SwapBuffers()
3111// Those functions pointers exists only for the benefit of RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3112// - If you have very specific rendering needs (e.g. flipping multiple swap-chain simultaneously, unusual sync/threading issues, etc.),
3113// you may be tempted to ignore RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() and write customized code to perform your renderingg.
3114// You may decide to setup the platform_io's *RenderWindow and *SwapBuffers pointers and call your functions through those pointers,
3115// or you may decide to never setup those pointers and call your code directly. They are a convenience, not an obligatory interface.
3116//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3117
3118// (Optional) Access via ImGui::GetPlatformIO()
3119struct ImGuiPlatformIO
3120{
3121 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3122 // Input - Backend interface/functions + Monitor List
3123 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3124
3125 // (Optional) Platform functions (e.g. Win32, GLFW, SDL2)
3126 // For reference, the second column shows which function are generally calling the Platform Functions:
3127 // N = ImGui::NewFrame() ~ beginning of the dear imgui frame: read info from platform/OS windows (latest size/position)
3128 // F = ImGui::Begin(), ImGui::EndFrame() ~ during the dear imgui frame
3129 // U = ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows() ~ after the dear imgui frame: create and update all platform/OS windows
3130 // R = ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() ~ render
3131 // D = ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindows() ~ shutdown
3132 // The general idea is that NewFrame() we will read the current Platform/OS state, and UpdatePlatformWindows() will write to it.
3133 //
3134 // The functions are designed so we can mix and match 2 imgui_impl_xxxx files, one for the Platform (~window/input handling), one for Renderer.
3135 // Custom engine backends will often provide both Platform and Renderer interfaces and so may not need to use all functions.
3136 // Platform functions are typically called before their Renderer counterpart, apart from Destroy which are called the other way.
3137
3138 // Platform function --------------------------------------------------- Called by -----
3139 void (*Platform_CreateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Create a new platform window for the given viewport
3140 void (*Platform_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . U . D //
3141 void (*Platform_ShowWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Newly created windows are initially hidden so SetWindowPos/Size/Title can be called on them before showing the window
3142 void (*Platform_SetWindowPos)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 pos); // . . U . . // Set platform window position (given the upper-left corner of client area)
3143 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowPos)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . //
3144 void (*Platform_SetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Set platform window client area size (ignoring OS decorations such as OS title bar etc.)
3145 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window client area size
3146 void (*Platform_SetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Move window to front and set input focus
3147 bool (*Platform_GetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . //
3148 bool (*Platform_GetWindowMinimized)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window minimized state. When minimized, we generally won't attempt to get/set size and contents will be culled more easily
3149 void (*Platform_SetWindowTitle)(ImGuiViewport* vp, const char* str); // . . U . . // Set platform window title (given an UTF-8 string)
3150 void (*Platform_SetWindowAlpha)(ImGuiViewport* vp, float alpha); // . . U . . // (Optional) Setup global transparency (not per-pixel transparency)
3151 void (*Platform_UpdateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // (Optional) Called by UpdatePlatformWindows(). Optional hook to allow the platform backend from doing general book-keeping every frame.
3152 void (*Platform_RenderWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Main rendering (platform side! This is often unused, or just setting a "current" context for OpenGL bindings). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3153 void (*Platform_SwapBuffers)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers (platform side! This is often unused!). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3154 float (*Platform_GetWindowDpiScale)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Return DPI scale for this viewport. 1.0f = 96 DPI.
3155 void (*Platform_OnChangedViewport)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . F . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Called during Begin() every time the viewport we are outputting into changes, so backend has a chance to swap fonts to adjust style.
3156 int (*Platform_CreateVkSurface)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImU64 vk_inst, const void* vk_allocators, ImU64* out_vk_surface); // (Optional) For a Vulkan Renderer to call into Platform code (since the surface creation needs to tie them both).
3157
3158 // (Optional) Renderer functions (e.g. DirectX, OpenGL, Vulkan)
3159 void (*Renderer_CreateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Create swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_CreateWindow)
3160 void (*Renderer_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . U . D // Destroy swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called before Platform_DestroyWindow)
3161 void (*Renderer_SetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Resize swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_SetWindowSize)
3162 void (*Renderer_RenderWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Clear framebuffer, setup render target, then render the viewport->DrawData. 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3163 void (*Renderer_SwapBuffers)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers. 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3164
3165 // (Optional) Monitor list
3166 // - Updated by: app/backend. Update every frame to dynamically support changing monitor or DPI configuration.
3167 // - Used by: dear imgui to query DPI info, clamp popups/tooltips within same monitor and not have them straddle monitors.
3168 ImVector<ImGuiPlatformMonitor> Monitors;
3169
3170 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3171 // Output - List of viewports to render into platform windows
3172 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3173
3174 // Viewports list (the list is updated by calling ImGui::EndFrame or ImGui::Render)
3175 // (in the future we will attempt to organize this feature to remove the need for a "main viewport")
3176 ImVector<ImGuiViewport*> Viewports; // Main viewports, followed by all secondary viewports.
3177 ImGuiPlatformIO() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); } // Zero clear
3178};
3179
3180// (Optional) This is required when enabling multi-viewport. Represent the bounds of each connected monitor/display and their DPI.
3181// We use this information for multiple DPI support + clamping the position of popups and tooltips so they don't straddle multiple monitors.
3182struct ImGuiPlatformMonitor
3183{
3184 ImVec2 MainPos, MainSize; // Coordinates of the area displayed on this monitor (Min = upper left, Max = bottom right)
3185 ImVec2 WorkPos, WorkSize; // Coordinates without task bars / side bars / menu bars. Used to avoid positioning popups/tooltips inside this region. If you don't have this info, please copy the value for MainPos/MainSize.
3186 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI
3187 ImGuiPlatformMonitor() { MainPos = MainSize = WorkPos = WorkSize = ImVec2(0, 0); DpiScale = 1.0f; }
3188};
3189
3190// (Optional) Support for IME (Input Method Editor) via the io.SetPlatformImeDataFn() function.
3191struct ImGuiPlatformImeData
3192{
3193 bool WantVisible; // A widget wants the IME to be visible
3194 ImVec2 InputPos; // Position of the input cursor
3195 float InputLineHeight; // Line height
3196
3197 ImGuiPlatformImeData() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
3198};
3199
3200//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3201// [SECTION] Obsolete functions and types
3202// (Will be removed! Read 'API BREAKING CHANGES' section in imgui.cpp for details)
3203// Please keep your copy of dear imgui up to date! Occasionally set '#define IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS' in imconfig.h to stay ahead.
3204//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3205
3206namespace ImGui
3207{
3208#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
3209 IMGUI_API int GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey key); // map ImGuiKey_* values into legacy native key index. == io.KeyMap[key]
3210#else
3211 static inline int GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey key) { IM_ASSERT(key >= ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END && "ImGuiKey and native_index was merged together and native_index is disabled by IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO. Please switch to ImGuiKey."); return key; }
3212#endif
3213}
3214
3215#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
3216namespace ImGui
3217{
3218 // OBSOLETED in 1.86 (from November 2021)
3219 IMGUI_API void CalcListClipping(int items_count, float items_height, int* out_items_display_start, int* out_items_display_end); // Calculate coarse clipping for large list of evenly sized items. Prefer using ImGuiListClipper.
3220 // OBSOLETED in 1.85 (from August 2021)
3221 static inline float GetWindowContentRegionWidth() { return GetWindowContentRegionMax().x - GetWindowContentRegionMin().x; }
3222 // OBSOLETED in 1.81 (from February 2021)
3223 IMGUI_API bool ListBoxHeader(const char* label, int items_count, int height_in_items = -1); // Helper to calculate size from items_count and height_in_items
3224 static inline bool ListBoxHeader(const char* label, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0)) { return BeginListBox(label, size); }
3225 static inline void ListBoxFooter() { EndListBox(); }
3226 // OBSOLETED in 1.79 (from August 2020)
3227 static inline void OpenPopupContextItem(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiMouseButton mb = 1) { OpenPopupOnItemClick(str_id, mb); } // Bool return value removed. Use IsWindowAppearing() in BeginPopup() instead. Renamed in 1.77, renamed back in 1.79. Sorry!
3228 // OBSOLETED in 1.78 (from June 2020)
3229 // Old drag/sliders functions that took a 'float power = 1.0' argument instead of flags.
3230 // For shared code, you can version check at compile-time with `#if IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 17704`.
3231 IMGUI_API bool DragScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, float power);
3232 IMGUI_API bool DragScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, float power);
3233 static inline bool DragFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return DragScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3234 static inline bool DragFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3235 static inline bool DragFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3236 static inline bool DragFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3237 IMGUI_API bool SliderScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, float power);
3238 IMGUI_API bool SliderScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, float power);
3239 static inline bool SliderFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3240 static inline bool SliderFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3241 static inline bool SliderFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3242 static inline bool SliderFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power) { return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); }
3243 // OBSOLETED in 1.77 (from June 2020)
3244 static inline bool BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id, ImGuiMouseButton mb, bool over_items) { return BeginPopupContextWindow(str_id, mb | (over_items ? 0 : ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems)); }

3260}
3261
3262// OBSOLETED in 1.82 (from Mars 2021): flags for AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), AddImageRounded(), PathRect()
3263typedef ImDrawFlags ImDrawCornerFlags;
3264enum ImDrawCornerFlags_
3265{
3266 ImDrawCornerFlags_None = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone, // Was == 0 prior to 1.82, this is now == ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone which is != 0 and not implicit
3267 ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft, // Was == 0x01 (1 << 0) prior to 1.82. Order matches ImDrawFlags_NoRoundCorner* flag (we exploit this internally).
3268 ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight, // Was == 0x02 (1 << 1) prior to 1.82.
3269 ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft, // Was == 0x04 (1 << 2) prior to 1.82.
3270 ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight, // Was == 0x08 (1 << 3) prior to 1.82.
3271 ImDrawCornerFlags_All = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll, // Was == 0x0F prior to 1.82
3272 ImDrawCornerFlags_Top = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight,
3273 ImDrawCornerFlags_Bot = ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight,
3274 ImDrawCornerFlags_Left = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft,
3275 ImDrawCornerFlags_Right = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight
3276};
3277
3278// RENAMED ImGuiKeyModFlags -> ImGuiModFlags in 1.88 (from April 2022)
3279typedef int ImGuiKeyModFlags;
3280enum ImGuiKeyModFlags_ { ImGuiKeyModFlags_None = ImGuiModFlags_None, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl = ImGuiModFlags_Ctrl, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift = ImGuiModFlags_Shift, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt = ImGuiModFlags_Alt, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super = ImGuiModFlags_Super };
3281
3282#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
3283

3286#if defined(__clang__)
3287#pragma clang diagnostic pop
3288#elif defined(__GNUC__)

3290#endif
3291
3292#ifdef _MSC_VER
3293#pragma warning (pop)
3294#endif
